reviews.name: Dawn Dudley Johnson
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text: I thoroughly enjoy this chromebook at 15.6 inches.  A Quality Product, much less expensive than a notebook;  which I really don't need.  Able to access anything on the Internet, and it has a documents function too. However at work in the library we have access to full size computers, cpu's, and monitors.  They are much easier for me to use;  if you are considering that option. This is  a great  product,  and I highly recommend it!

reviews.name: bj
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018
reviews.title: No issues/no problems
reviews.review_text: I wanted to wait until I had used this item for a couple of weeks before completing a review . There have been no issues and no problems and it arrived on time and at a good price. This is the second ACER I have had and both have been reliable with excellent battery life.  It's a fairly basic unit but for what I use it for, I am pleased with it.

reviews.name: Denise P.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
reviews.title: Great value for the money!
reviews.review_text: Great value! If you are embedded in the Google environment, it will do everything you need. You have to remember, it is basically just a web-browsing machine, but a fast one! Easy to set up, easy to tweak! Great for kids or adults! If someone is not a computer expert, they will handle this machine just fine. The screen is big, bright, and quality construction. Overall, great value for the money.

reviews.name: Joel Tai
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2018
reviews.title: Absolute value for money.
reviews.review_text: Cheap and good.

reviews.name: brownj
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
reviews.title: Great everyday laptop
reviews.review_text: As one user stated the screen resolution and hue not good. I find the screen sharpness and brightness great. It has good balanced color. This laptop works fast enough for my use, videos are smooth and downloads fast.

reviews.name: Jennifer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
reviews.title: Should have bought a regular laptop.
reviews.review_text: Runs slower than expected. Harder to navigate around programs than expected. Keyboard doesn't have all the buttons than on a regular keyboard. This model is larger than a regular chromebook.  Bought it for size of the screen. Make sure this is compatible with your school or college program. Bought a mouse to connect to for easier navigation. Battery life is good, comes with wall charger. I should have bought a regular laptop to use for college school work, it would have been much easier to use. Chromebook programs run differently.

reviews.name: KD
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
reviews.title: Love my Acer Chromebook
reviews.review_text: LOVE, LOVE  my new ACER. I had another one but the prong that the charger attaches to became loose and would not hold a charge without my holding it on and pushing it in. If I let go, it would die. So, because I loved my other one I replaced it with the newer one and everything synced perfectly.  Great gift idea or for a student even an elderly person, which I am,

reviews.name: K. Bryan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
reviews.title: May have motherboard issues
reviews.review_text: The product came in great shape from the seller.  I received it in late July 2019 and did not use it until the school year began in late August 2019.  At about the 10th time of using it, it would either not turn on or when it would turn on, it would "go black" and not come on again for days.  A friend who is good with computers said the motherboard is likely bad.  After being used maybe 10 times??

reviews.name: Dan I
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2018
reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
reviews.review_text: I love it I plugged it in turned it on and I had to type my password from my Network it came right up signed into Google and it's working great couldn't be happier

reviews.name: kittymeow me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2018
reviews.title: Just right laptop.
reviews.review_text: Great laptop, fast, lightweight and just what expected.

reviews.name: Derek Rhodes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2019
reviews.title: Make sure you don't mind Google Drive or Cloud based storage
reviews.review_text: I love the ease of use. I am a an avid Android user. I absolutely despise any and ALL Apple products. So naturally this is an ideal item. From what I've read and heard from other Chromebook users, Apple does do JUST Fine on these machines. The only downside is obviously the Internal Storage Capacity. For example, I have 16 GB storage and it suits me just fine as long as I remember to send to my Google Drive. So all in all, The Best buy I've personally made of a laptop. By the way, More Storage would have gained that Fifth star! Thanks Acer and Chrome OS!

reviews.name: Desiree Wyatt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
reviews.title: Dog
reviews.review_text: As many have warned, it is speedy out of the box - but once in use it SLOWS to s CRAWL. It works so hard to get onto the internet it slows or blocks access when our second computer is simultaneously running.  When we shut the second computer down, it does no better.  Since it has very little room for saving files and that can bog-down its performance, I removed everything unnecessary that would have been suspect.  It made no difference.  Get your Chromebook from anyone else but Acer.

reviews.name: Brian Lau
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
reviews.title: Acer Chromebook stopped working in less than 6 months.
reviews.review_text: After less than 6 months of normal use, my Acer Chromebook stopped powering up. I contacted Acer tech support via digital messaging and they guessed that it may be a power supply problem. They sent me a new one, but it did not correct the problem. I called them today (Thursday) and they want me to wait until after the weekend just to have instructions emailed to me on how to send the product back for repair. I would also need to pay for the shipping from NY to Texas. I am very disappointed with the product and support.

reviews.name: richard gibney
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2018
reviews.title: Great Laptop
reviews.review_text: Very easy to set up, fast, lightweight, operates well

reviews.name: Maleia
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2018
reviews.title: The camera is trash
reviews.review_text: I'm upset that it doesn't have backlit which is the keyboard that is supposed to light up... When the details told me it had it but other than that I like it

reviews.name: Teresa Gurries
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
reviews.title: Disappointed-not all that satisfied....
reviews.review_text: 1. Usually, only a third of the page is visible at one time, because the top and bottom tool bars (I guess) are very wide. 2. There is an unbelievable amount of pop up ads, when I'm trying to read something. 3. There's no mouse, and it would be much easier to navigate with a mouse. 4. The pages disappear for no reason, whether I'm typing, or trying to read something. 5. It is difficult to keep the zoom in feature at one setting-the page's size increases and decreases with no warning. Admittedly, I am not real technologically savvy, but other computers have not been so difficult for me to navigate. I will look in the settings and try to disable the popups, and see if there is anything I can do about the toolbars, but, overall, I'm not really happy with my purchase.

reviews.name: Barbara Kerrin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
reviews.title: Hate the keyboard......
reviews.review_text: Trying to type this now on a very awkward keyboard.  Everything else seems to be OK so far.  Easy set up and battery storage seems good -- only one week of using.  The tiny keyboard in the middle of a huge plastic expanse is really difficult to use. No "end of line" key and some random keys across the top of the keyboard with no explanation of what they do (???)  I don't have touch screen capabilities

reviews.name: Emmet Hunt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
reviews.title: If changing from windows, do not buy this laptop. It is TOTALLY different. ust
reviews.review_text: I owned a Asus windows 10 laptop. I was not aware that this computer is prioritized. Help and customer service is a joke. Unless you are totally computer knowledgeable for chromebook do not purchase this unit. I retired as an Aircraft Engine Tech and without help this unit is almost useless.  It does not come with user instructions and will not accept my HP4650 printer. What a disappointment. Emmet Hunt

reviews.name: Jennifer C.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
reviews.title: A great pc
reviews.review_text: A great computer for kids school work or a first pc.  Actually anyone would like this if they need a good computer and the size is decent.

reviews.name: Big AL
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
reviews.title: Great Chromebook Great price
reviews.review_text: WiFi connection is fast. Connection with printer must be google cloud print enabled. I connected my HP printer over WiFi no problem. The computer is fast and easy to set up. Not full of ads. Speakers are fine. Keyboard is easy to use.

reviews.name: Gearld Murrenus
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2018
reviews.title: Faithful chrome
reviews.review_text: It doesn't have all the fancy options like touch screen. But all the buttons work and its reliable.

reviews.name: Elinor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
reviews.title: Need a code to work
reviews.review_text: I believe this product would have served my purpose had I had a cell phone to receive the verification code. Not having one I tried the other suggested methods they said, and it didn't recognize my email or home phone . Hence without a cell phone don't buy this product. Being a senior on a budget I don't like having to purchase something in order to use something else.

reviews.name: Sippriano
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
reviews.title: Surprised at the Quality! It's Great! Much better than expected!
reviews.review_text: Just got this today! Speakers are better quality than I expected. The keyboard took a little adjusting too, but once I started typing for a bit it was fine. The screen is a nice sized. Easy to set up. For the price this was well worth the money! I'm very pleased with this Chromebook. I was just looking to replace a laptop I had for quite a while but didn't want to spend a lot of money. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable option.

reviews.name: Liz
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
reviews.title: Unreliable USB ports
reviews.review_text: Great little computer for basic use. However, within 3 weeks began having issues with both USB ports. I keep a cooling fan under this at all times, which began having difficulties connecting at either port. I also direct-connect internet via an adapter. This too has had issues. I've replaced the adapters 2 times thinking that was the issue, but still same problems. Both USB ports appear to have "short-like" issues. Sometimes they work, sometimes not. No rhyme nor reason. I do NOT recommend this computer due to these hardware issues. Unfortunate, because it otherwise perfect for my needs.

reviews.name: john coy sawyer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018
reviews.title: For its price, a good value.
reviews.review_text: It has met my expectation.

reviews.name: glen pollard !
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
reviews.title: great chromebook & even better price !
reviews.review_text: great looking laptop. you'd never know it's refurbished. i got it today, 4 days early ! fast shipping ! i'd definitly reccomend this to anyone looking for a great chromebook. right now the battery is showing 11 hrs 44 min at 100%. update: it's now showing 13 hrs 46 min at 100%. update: 1/6/2020- i'm getting 12 hrs & 9 minutes at 96%.

reviews.name: Kirstein Howell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2018
reviews.title: I'll buy more
reviews.review_text: For personal use and didn't want to invest a lot. This does everything I need it to do, but I only use it for simple tasks like email, and word processing. No trouble playing videos or music

reviews.name: Daniel J. McCaffrey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018
reviews.title: Excellent Chromebook.
reviews.review_text: Everything about is great, and it meets all of my needs; it's lightweight, durable and so far I haven't used it enough at one siting to drain the battery. My only complaint would be the speakers, which are not quite as good as I hoped, but really, no reason why I wouldn't heartily recommend this to anyone.

reviews.name: Michael H
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
reviews.title: Got this as a gift for my stepfather
reviews.review_text: Absolutely perfect for him as he’s not into gaming or anything serious that requires serious hardware. For browsing and such this is great, actually much larger than I expected. Years ago I had one of the first chrome books which was very small, this is the size of a full laptop. Fast opening speed, hardly a difference from my $2400 Alienware r9 opening a google chrome window.

reviews.name: PEN15
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
reviews.title: SLOW!
reviews.review_text: I purchased this Chromebook to replace an older one.  I love the speaker upgrade but, it is so slow compared to my old one.  Pages take a long time to load and when you want to print, it stays on the load screen for several minutes.

reviews.name: Katie Krupinski
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
reviews.title: You pulled a fast one on me.
reviews.review_text: MISLEADING DESCRIPTION OF ITEM!!! The description of this laptop is not for the laptop they are actually selling. This IS NOT a touch screen. There IS NO DVD DRIVE I did not realize that down below the description of this laptop in the features section it explains this is a no touch screen and no dvd drive. Very misleading. Horrible. Only keeping this because I bought it for my daughter for Xmas and I don’t have time to try to return it and get another one before Xmas. Thanks for the headache.

reviews.name: Sleepy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
reviews.title: Laggy
reviews.review_text: I bought a refurbished product for $139.  Very good price, and glad to have the most recent OS but the chromebook itself is very laggy to load pages, take input, etc.  I have one with 2 gb ram, I would suggest going for 4 gb if you want to use this regularly.

reviews.name: Amazon fan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
reviews.title: I'm happy I tried the chromebook.
reviews.review_text: Different from what I was used to but adjusted pretty fast.  Boots up really fast compared, and transferring old photos over was real easy.  My dad loaned me his to try out, and since he really liked his I would have a tutor if need be, but I liked it right away.

reviews.name: robnrob2
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
reviews.title: Great machne great value
reviews.review_text: Well my old lap top was S L O W and was my 1st,, I didnt know what solid state was,, This chrome book is fast, I really like it, and it does all I need to do.

reviews.name: Kelly G Bartlett
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
reviews.title: Great value
reviews.review_text: Bought this for my dad who needs something simple and this was a great value. Setting up is really easy and he's as haooybas can be. Fast as can be and is perfect for someone that just uses basic internet services. Very pleased.

reviews.name: Doug W. Huchteman
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019
reviews.title: Google sucks
reviews.review_text: It's a chromebook not a laptop,sadly

reviews.name: Mr. David Rockville
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019
reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.review_text: Easy to get running. Long life battery, and plenty of power.

reviews.name: Susan teeters
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2018
reviews.title: I loved the price.
reviews.review_text: I love everything about my Cromebook, I'm very pleased.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
reviews.title: Just spend more on a better one
reviews.review_text: I do not have to much experience with lab tops. But Overall the computer is lacking in all qualities from what I can tell, with horrible screen quality no touch screen and half the battery life that was advertised. I had never used the chrome OS and realized it’s very limiting.It’s much slower than I expected it would’ve been.  Amazon recommended I buy antivirus with it so I did. Only to realize the chrome os will not accept most anti virus software.  In the end I figured $300 would get me an okay labtop I wasn’t expecting too much but I’m incredibly dissatisfied.

reviews.name: Simba
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
reviews.title: Super fast and convenient
reviews.review_text: User friendly right out of the box. It's super fast from start up to shut down. It's my go-to when I don't want to fire up the laptop but want something better than my phone. The battery life is incredible. Since I use Google apps for many things, this is ideal for me. Glad I got it.

reviews.name: Celine Nouvel
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
reviews.title: Less than 1 year review
reviews.review_text: I bought this laptop back in January and now it's mid-September. I am already having problems with processing power and freezing. I did buy the two-year warranty but I'm not sure how to access it, so I still have to reach out for a service request. Additionally, owning a Chromebook as a college student is actually quite annoying because a lot of programs you need to run don't support Chromebooks. So I end up having to find campus computers to do some work. I will edit my review once I've processed my service request.

reviews.name: Janelle Lancaster
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
reviews.title: Fast to learn operations
reviews.review_text: Easy to use

reviews.name: Ken Hendrick
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019
reviews.title: Glitchy as hell, barely usable with more than one Chrome tab open.
reviews.review_text: Very poor operability. Glitchy, slow, freezes constantly. More than one Chrome tab open results in constant loading, freezing, and poor usability. Don't even attempt to work back and forth between tabs or you're in for a real disappointment!

reviews.name: Rache Golden
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
reviews.title: Great for the price
reviews.review_text: This laptop is lightweight and easy to take on the go. I needed a new laptop for work and this one is perfect. It's affordable and surprisingly good. I've never had a Chromebook but I kinda like it. What I don't like is they keyboard. It's smaller and more condensed than others which makes it a little harder to type on. Not everything is at the same place as I'm used to. There's big speakers on either side of the keyboard that could have been put somewhere else to make room for the keys. But that's my only qualm. I would recommend this laptop.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
reviews.title: We Love Acer
reviews.review_text: Have bought 4 now. Work excellent!!!

reviews.name: Charles Pegram
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
reviews.title: Wife isn't tech savvy person and she loves it
reviews.review_text: My wife is not a tech savvy person and she loves this computer. She is able to use it without too much help. She uses this machine to get online to the bank and pay bills--anything that she won't use her phone for. It is a good deal.

reviews.name: Liberty
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
reviews.title: Earphone Jack Already Has Problems
reviews.review_text: I bought this Chromebook in August. I am very disappointed in it. It is really heavy, so a pain to carry around. The screen color is not very good. The real problem is that the earphone jack already doesn't work. It only plays one side of a set of earphones; sounds very weird, but true. It would have static (feedback like when you are trying to tune in a radio) when I would turn the earphone cord in the jack. I'm very sad that I spent money on this product.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019
reviews.title: Garbage
reviews.review_text: This is my second chrome book and the 4 year old one is better than this one.  Constantly drops WiFi making it useless. Really disappointing.

reviews.name: Charles Davis
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2019
reviews.title: You do need internet for the Chromebook to function correctly.
reviews.review_text: I couldn't be happier,  what a great surfboard! Amazing battery life with lightning speed! Really good speakers.. All in all a great experience!

reviews.name: Cuttiepie
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
reviews.title: Crap
reviews.review_text: Love chrombooks but this one is crappie. Picture shaddy. Can not do a lot with it simple task only. If you are experienced . Don't waste your money. For a small child learning.

reviews.name: Ralph W. Siddall
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2018
reviews.title: Great computer
reviews.review_text: Fast, solid feeling, real value.

reviews.name: Jerry Hill
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
reviews.title: Acer CB3-532 15.6" HD Chromebook - great computer and work station
reviews.review_text: Acer CB3-532 15.6" HD Chromebook - fast start up and just add external memory and as long as you have internet connection your golden. Can't beat the speed or performance.

reviews.name: RYAN
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
reviews.title: Solid computer for the price
reviews.review_text: Got it for my daughter.  She's very happy with it.  My only complaint would be the weight.  It is much heavier than my wife's laptop.

reviews.name: Donna Land
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
reviews.title: I Don't like it!
reviews.review_text: I can't put my password in it said it doesn't recognize. My password  I tried to get a new one but I can't . Only had  it one day.

reviews.name: c.j golden
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
reviews.title: Good basic computer
reviews.review_text: I only use this for most basic computer needs.  It’s fine for my needs.

reviews.name: Peachpatch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
reviews.title: MLB, NFL,  and UTUBE
reviews.review_text: Serves the purpose. Battery last a long time and quick start response. Operates in fine fashion. For the price I am quite content with this purchase so far .

reviews.name: MoonLilith
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2019
reviews.title: limited use, very slow
reviews.review_text: use it to manage social media for my business- so so

reviews.name: wof
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019
reviews.title: Good product good price
reviews.review_text: Long battery life, excellent screen.  It's a Chromebook, so it is fast and easy to use. My only criticism is that it is a bit heavy.  Other than that it is an excellent product.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
reviews.title: Didn't get a chance to operate. Came different than labeled
reviews.review_text: This was not a touchscreen unfortunately. Sad. Because that's not the description. It says multi touch screen.

reviews.name: kevin ruch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
reviews.title: Awesome laptop
reviews.review_text: Refurbished item, looks brand new and works great!!!! Very fast, I recommend this seller and this laptop!!!! Arrived early 😋

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text: Now that we communicate with Zoom type of meetings, I found my video didn't work.  Took it to a local vendor and he found a bad connector for video.  Fixed it and cost me $25.  Thinking all was well, I then went to a meeting and found the audio from me was delayed a bunch.  Checked internet status with another computer, and works great... so the problem is not internet...VERY FRUSTRATING....

reviews.name: Waterrat
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
reviews.title: Works well
reviews.review_text: Does what a Chromebook should

reviews.name: Rachael Facenda
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
reviews.review_text: There are some quirky things about the chromebook.  It only prints a PDF file and operates much the same as a Tab A, only on a bigger screen.  Hopefully, learning more about it will change my mind.

reviews.name: Smith
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
reviews.title: Robust, versatile and handy
reviews.review_text: Great plug and play laptop. Does everything needed for a casual computer user and the Chromebook OS  takes away all the hassle you normally get with Windows. Feels sturdy and all the buttons and keyboard are solid. Nice work, Acer!

reviews.name: barry burcham
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
reviews.title: not new but used
reviews.review_text: was to be a new acer but it was a used on that some had set it on warrenty with acer in june 2019 going to give it my grand daughter but would like some type of credit on my account for it

reviews.name: Brian
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.review_text: I bought this for my wife to be on the internet at home. It worked great for 6 months and now it is dropping wifi constantly.

reviews.name: KJ of Vista
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
reviews.title: Chromebook: primary uses
reviews.review_text: Delivery was quicker than promised, which was great.  Since the product is a Chromebook, users should expect to use the Google suite apps for documents and use the device primarily for surfing the web.

reviews.name: Kurt W. Fioretti
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2019
reviews.title: Great Machine
reviews.review_text: I bought two of these for my daughters for Christmas. They both love them and do everything that they need. Fast shipping and very good price. Very satisfied.

reviews.name: catjm
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018
reviews.title: Missing keys?
reviews.review_text: Good computer for the value. It was simple to set up. I use it primarily to watch online, so cannot speak to the functionality. The only thing I find curious about the computer is it has no delete, home or end keys. These keys are useful when typing.

reviews.name: JD
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
reviews.title: Bought it for our 9 year old and it’s great for what we wanted.
reviews.review_text: Bought this for our 9 year old to have her own computer for school work, web browsing and streaming and it is perfect for that use. Pretty surprise how nice the graphics are for such a cheap laptop!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
reviews.title: Super value
reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing value. I had another laptop that was just too slow for my needs. I love chrome.

reviews.name: Cait
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
reviews.review_text: I bought this for my son and he uses it daily! We've had no issues with it. Great product!

reviews.name: Robert Bioski
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2018
reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.review_text: Very easy to set up,Chromebooks are the way to go,and this one performs excellent!!Very much recommended!!

reviews.name: vjmount57
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
reviews.title: Love it!!
reviews.review_text: Easy to use.  Wanted a new laptop and I made a good choice.

reviews.name: Error
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
reviews.title: Good buy if you know what your getting
reviews.review_text: I bought this Chromebook basically out of curiosity. I've never had a Chromebook before but I have owned Windows, Apple, and Linux systems. I wanted to see just how useful it really is when used as a laptop replacement. I think a large percentage of the laptop community still has no freaking idea what chrome OS is. They were spoon fed Windows from birth. This review will make sense to the tech community, for the Win world - not so much. This Chromebook uses a somewhat customized version of Android operating system. My reading suggests about version 4.4. Before you let that dissuade you from getting one, it actually works quite well. The screen is not touch sensitive, but the track pad recognizes a two finger touch as a context menu - akin to a Windows right click. Access to the play store allowed me to quickly populate it with everything I needed to get through my day. I can work with zip,tar, and other compressed formats, and open almost any file I set my sights on. The one exception was a docx word file. My word processor only handled doc files. I could probably get around this by using the online version of MS Word but haven't tried that yet. Since tax season is coming up I tried three of the more popular online tax packages to see how they worked with it. I was able to work in TurboTax, Taxcut, and H&R block without any issues. The TurboTax version uses a very cool import to take a PDF copy of your W-2 and import and fill in all the fields. This worked flawlessly. I was also able to connect my wireless brother printer in a matter of minutes. This is kind of impressive for an older version of Android but by simply downloading the brother application for printers, I had set it up without hardly in any intervention from me. It just found it, like Win10 does with wireless printers.  This Chromebook comes with 32GB of storage but has the ability to use an SD card for an upgrade. I was able to upgrade it with an additional 256gb for no more than $65. the response time on applications was well within the margin of what you would expect for a normal laptop. Everything opened quickly and applications did what they were supposed to do without any hesitation. I will say that on first impressions, the plastic casing of the Chromebook looks kind of cheap. but then again it is kind of cheap at less than two hundred dollars you're not going to get a stainless steel case. This would make a perfect workbook to take on a plane and get some work done or something to just sit around and browse internet all day. The battery life is supposed to be at around 11 hours and from what I've seen so far it looks like it would make that. I was able to use it off and on pretty much all day and only used about 50% battery reserve. It is also less than 3 pounds. It's so light you can forget you have it with you. It also is not bad for watching movies on. I installed the Netflix app and streamed several hours of video with no drop outs. All said, I think this makes a good inexpensive all around computing device as long as you have generic tasks; watching videos, browsing, writing your book. If you don't need to compile code for your daytime job you will do fine.

reviews.name: THX1138
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
reviews.title: Samsung Chromebook - just what I needed
reviews.review_text: I purchased the 32-bit Samsung Chromebook 3.  I wanted a Samsung unit to go with my Note 3, Note 4 and must recent purchase a Note 8. What great machine.. all for under $200! I charged it up and downloaded the OS update. I’m impressed with the speed, weight, and quality of this product. The fact that isn’t touch is okay with me. The mouse pad is very responsive and easy to use.  I like the non-reflective screen, the screen brightness control makes easy to read in daylight. Instant startup is a joy. The USB 3 and second ports USB 2 and HDMI with the longest battery-life are what sold me.  I wrote this review with the unit. Impressive, I'm a CHROME fan for sure. My favorite Play Store app - ISS HD Live.

reviews.name: po1013
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
reviews.title: screen not very bright, get the 2017 if you can find one.
reviews.review_text: I ordered the 2017 Samsung laptop model but they shipped the newer 2018 model.  I wanted the 2017 because I had already read the newer one''s screen wasn't as bright and had tried out a 2017 at a BxxxBxx store a couple months earlier, and  YUP,  it is true.  In the course of dealing w/ Amazon to "exchange" the 2018 model for the one I actually ordered, the price  went up considerably on the  older (and better reviewed) model, so I kept the 2018.  It's "okay" for what I need, but not nearly as good as my old Samsung 2nd generation, which I still use but now has to be tethered full-time to the cord--so not too portable anymore...

reviews.name: Lisa S
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2018
reviews.title: Good chrome book for the price
reviews.review_text: Works good, is lightweight, screen is decent enough quality for the price. I mostly use it for watching movies and researching my ancestry and it does a great job job. I love it.

reviews.name: Frederick E. Hutchings
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
reviews.title: Fast and Easy
reviews.review_text: Fell in love with the chromebook. Was a little skeptical about the CLOUD thing, but there's no question that it gets online quicker.  Operating System being designed around the browser or vice-versa is an excellent idea.

reviews.name: David V.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2017
reviews.title: 2017 Samsung
reviews.review_text: I just purchased this lap top for basic uses. I own a Samsung phone and tablet and I'm very happy with them. I will update my review on Wednesday when my laptop arrives. I received my laptop today and it was simple to set up. Keep in mind it's s very basic computer but does everything I need it to do. I'm very happy with Google and Chrome

reviews.name: Harlan Ryerson
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2018
reviews.title: Major Problems
reviews.review_text: I have had a lot of problems with this chromebook. Even more than my other chromebook. Not satisfied at all. Switching back to Microsoft or Apple. The savings are not worth the frustration.

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
reviews.title: nice machine but its not for me.
reviews.review_text: you can browse the internet and thats about all the machine is good for. 🤷🏼‍♀️ not gona work for me- i take and edit a lot of photos, download music etc.

reviews.name: Daniel M. Parker
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
reviews.title: My Favorite Laptop Ever
reviews.review_text: It arrived at my door for under $200. It boots fast. It's easy to carry. It doesn't get hot. It has a long battery life. Updates are quick, simpe, and mostly in the background. It is easy to charge with a small lightweight wall-wort with a long cord. All my life I've been looking for a lightweight, easy to use, on the go computer for writing. I have had just about every small laptop over the last 20 years. This is by far the best of all of them I've tried. My jam is to take off into the woods and write. It's what I like doing. I don't want to spend time dealing with my writing device, I want to turn it on and write, I want to turn it off and have my writing saved. I want it to check my spelling. The lack of a right mouse button or a scroll wheel will throw a lot of people at first, but if you see the charms in this little box you will be compelled to use the Googles and look up how to use a Chromebook mouse pad. It is worth learning and will simplify your life. You can install apps from Google Play, Youtube works super well, many apps will run including Microsoft Office. There are good apps and avenues to log in to a remote desktop either Linux or Windows. It isn't a gaming computer, and I wouldn't try to do heavy photoshop or other graphics on it. TLDNR; It cost less than $200, it is durable, it runs all day, it is easy to use. It is great at a lot of things. It isn't good for some things.

reviews.name: Lala Orange
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
reviews.title: Received a different model/color.
reviews.review_text: Received model XE501C13-K02US in color Night Charcoal (Gray), instead of the XE500C13-K03US in color Black (which is what is pictured and described in this listing). The hard shell casing I ordered for the older XE500C13-K03US model will not fit the newer model so I have to return that too :(

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2019
reviews.title: Great little laptop for kids
reviews.review_text: As my children get older, they have more and more projects and things that would require a laptop (plus games...let's be honest). I am never thrilled when they use mine and was happy to get this one for a great price. The screen quality is nothing to write home about, but they are typing up reports and playing online puzzled etc...nothing more is really needed. Sturdy, solid chromebook with no unnecessary bells and whistles. Very happy with this purchase

reviews.name: Taylor Wagner
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
reviews.title: Complete piece of garbage.
reviews.review_text: An absolute waste of money. Operates the same as a tablet, and is unable to accomplish the most basic tasks. I am so angry that I wasted money on this piece of trash. Just found out that I missed the return window by 3 days, and after contacting Samsung, they are unable to take it as a return as well. Very tempted to just light it on fire since I clearly won't be getting my money back, just for the satisfaction of watching this headache burn. Bought it as a Christmas gift to myself, since I haven't had the funds to purchase a computer (and have lived without one for the last 3 years) and wishing I had just flushed my money down my toilet instead, as that would have been more satisfying than trying over, and over, and over again to navigate such a ridiculously worthless and ineffective operating system. If you are buying this product for every-day tasks, such as; printing, navigating web pages, playing games, etc., look elsewhere. Just about the only thing this Chromebook is good for, is checking your e-mail.

reviews.name: Donald Clark
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
reviews.title: Lousy customer service!!!!!
reviews.review_text: I enjoyed this item for the 2 months i had it. I opened it one day and saw what looked like a cracked screen. Upon further inspection I see that it was what looked like a burst cells inside. Not sure of the precise term but i sent it in and was told it aas due to "physical damage" ....i was always extremely careful amd it was never dropped like they say it was. I will mever buy another samsung product again....and you should not either. But then if you want to and it doesn't last more than 2 months remember i warned you.

reviews.name: ab
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018
reviews.title: Wonderful product and very easy to use.
reviews.review_text: I am really happy with the chromebook, it was given as a gift to me by my loved one very close to me.It is a wonderful product. Thank you AB

reviews.name: Tal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2019
reviews.title: Good value for money Chromebook
reviews.review_text: A very good return for your money, fast and intuitive.

reviews.name: Eric Cunningham
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
reviews.title: Decent Chromebook but could use some improvements
reviews.review_text: This is the third Chromebook that I have purchased. My first was a refurbished one that I needed in an emergency that only lasted 3 months. My second was a previous Samsung model and it lasted me about 2.5-3 years. I have the same issues with this Chromebook as I do my last Samsung one: 1- The audio jack: the audio is incredibly static-y when using normal headphones. When using headphones I pretty much have to find some sort of white noise to play in the background to coverup the static, or use a bluetooth headset. It's incredibly aggravating at times. 2- The screen. I'm not sure if it's the way I store it in my bag or what, when the Chromebook is closed, it makes contact with the keyboard, and needs frequent cleanings. I'm not sure if it's that the back cover is too soft and pliable or what, but this is a common issue. Now, when I go to clean the screen, no matter how gentle I am, it's inevitable that I will get damages pixels in the screen. I replaced the screen in my previous Samsung Chromebook twice in the 2.5-3 years that I had it for, and on this one I can already see some spots that are becoming damaged. I was hoping with this later model that some of these issues would be improved on, but It doesn't look like it. For anyone who has a Chromebook, I would also recommend getting rid of the ChromeOS and making the switch to Linux's GalliumOS. It's definitely worth it, and will put that hardware to better use.

reviews.name: E. Arnold
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
reviews.title: Works great, performance is excellent
reviews.review_text: For a Chromebook... this is GREAT!  Understand, this is a Chromebook... but I did get a 256GB micro SD card to expand the storage space... that works great too.  My son loves it since he uses an X box for gaming and his phone for most other things... this fits the bill for that in-between technology that he was missing - a place to type up things (office business/school), emails, web-browsing, and applications that are familiar to someone that uses a Samsung S10 phone (Android).  The OS is Android so remember that... not Windows (for the novice techie).  Samsung as a real winner here.

reviews.name: Maria
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2019
reviews.title: Computer is great
reviews.review_text: Setup on this computer took less than 3 minutes. Super easy. I was a little nervous because the documentation that came with the computer was minimal - but that's all you need! I have a Windows background, but so far so good. Boot time and shut down is quick! I had some experience with Google Drive so all my documents and spreadsheets automatically showed up since they are in the cloud. The battery seems to hold a charge and for a 11.6" computer, the keyboard is actually easy to type on. I do believe I'm hooked on the Chromebook.

reviews.name: celt67
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019
reviews.title: junk
reviews.review_text: Drops wifi so much it's almost useless.  Internet browser navigation is difficult as the buttons don't respond.  Don't buy this.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019
reviews.title: easy to use
reviews.review_text: I have been a chromebook user for about 8 years.  I am 83 years old and need simplicity.  It does everything I need it to do.  I don't play games except forthe word games.

reviews.name: Will
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
reviews.title: No Brainer Compared To Windows
reviews.review_text: This Chromebook is a fun product to play with and easy to set up. You can set Google Docs to work offline if need be, and slave it to your cell phone for Internet access.  My only disappointment is no full-sized SD card port, but that can be easily remedied.

reviews.name: D. Schmidt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
reviews.title: Screen is horrible, but not a bad little laptop
reviews.review_text: Runs fast, boots up almost immediately.  My only issue is that the screen is really bad. The main issue with the screen is viewing angle.  I think some other people have brought up that many of the positive reviews are of the previous model year (same model, a year prior) which had a much better screen. Viewed from below perpendicular it gets dark very quickly.  Viewed from above perpendicular and it washes out almost immediately.  View head on and the top will be dark while the bottom is bright and washed out.  Using the home screen and bright apps it's not too bad, but trying to watch videos it's unbearable.

reviews.name: Cole
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
reviews.title: Great for the kiddos.
reviews.review_text: So far so good. We needed a new laptop for our kids. This was such a better deal to purchase a chrome book which they love and know so well from their schools. They don’t need anything else as kids. If they were in college maybe but this works for our 13, 9, 7 and 5 year old. I purchased a wireless mouse separately for my little ones. I only wish the screen could get a little brighter but that wouldn’t of altered my decision to order. When we bought it it was under 200. Then we went back and purchased another just over 200. Good deal and I researched a lot of chrome books. We love them.

reviews.name: Blake Weihrauch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent Student Maching
reviews.review_text: If you have a student that uses cloud-based apps.  This is a great buy.  Consider an external hard drive for storage but it is a good machine for the money.

reviews.name: Metal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
reviews.title: Nice little laptops
reviews.review_text: These little Chromebooks are pretty nice for the money, but they have less customization than a Windows computer. However, Linux apps are allowed (IF your Chromebook has the memory for all the downloads). These dont allow everything to be saved and/or loaded from an SD card, so memory can become an annoying issue. All-in-all I love my little Chromebook. I use it all the time for college and to play music. The blutooth works perfectly and connects right to my phone. There are some features that need to be added, and from what I hear they will add more flexability in future updates. The battery life is a nice plus as well

reviews.name: Giorgio Zotalis
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2018
reviews.title: Beware
reviews.review_text: This item is not the same as in the picture,is a best buy product so check there website to see how it looks. I order two time from a different retailer and they are the same. And is not black is charcoal.

reviews.name: Ria
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
reviews.title: Good buy
reviews.review_text: Great value for money. Will only use it to watch Netflix and use the Google Chrome Apps. Really happy with this product.

reviews.name: Scott Gibson
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
reviews.title: Perfect for a student
reviews.review_text: This was given to my son for school work and it has worked perfectly. Slim design and light weight but seems capable of doing anything he needs to do for school and social media. Very happy with it.

reviews.name: Courtney Snyder
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
reviews.title: Good value for basic use
reviews.review_text: The specs of this computer are great for the price, especially considering the SSD hard drive. Ultimately I decided to return mine since it doesn't have an optical drive like the description says it does, coupled with no backlit keyboard and receiving the night charcoal (grey) instead of the ordered black.

reviews.name: Jam Meister
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2019
reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.review_text: I purchased this for my two high schoolers after their 1st Chromebook wore out.  Works very well, low power, very compact.  My only complaint is that the recharger plug/jack is very thin and might be prone to breaking.

reviews.name: Smit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
reviews.title: This laptop is so cheap, it breaks when you use it!
reviews.review_text: Worst laptop owned! It wont turn on! I used this just once, the next morning wont turn on! I put it on the charger (even though i just completely charged it) checked it every hour. Nothing change.

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2019
reviews.title: Defective charging port connection?
reviews.review_text: Just got this and it just the connection to the charging port is so loose the battery rarely charges.  The cord has to be perfectly positioned or it's not going to charge.  Will likely return it.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviews.title: This product is garbage.
reviews.review_text: Just for example, right now I'm trying to search for recipes by googling what I'd like. Each link I click on of course has many videos and ads which is an annoying thing about the internet these days regardless. But on this machine, it is unmanageable. It takes so long for the sites to load and then you can't scroll easily, keeps getting hung up. So I must do stuff like this on my phone instead. It's useless for even this simple function. For another thing. I'm trying to stream a movie. If you rewind or pause or do anything like that, it freezes, buffers forever. Even if you leave it alone and just let it play, it skips every few minutes. One last thing. My email is with yahoo. I know it's an old provider, but I don't want to change it- I've had it for years. The OS makes it extremely difficult to view my email or scroll through my messages. It has prompted me to download it into Drive and open it up that way, but if I wanted to use google for my email I'd do that. It annoys me that I must merge my yahoo mail with google rather than just being able to see it as if on any other computer I've ever used in my life. I have not tried to use it for anything else as it's brand new, but this should give you some idea of what a total piece of garbage this machine is, you can't even use it for extremely basic internet browsing. I wish I'd spent the money on something else. It is a total waste of money. -Carla

reviews.name: Timothy Taft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
reviews.title: I like it, I like it a lot.
reviews.review_text: Great little Chromebook, never worked with one before. I got the hang of it quickly. A lot of short cut keys built-in the keyboard. It is a little on the small side but I adapted. Works great and is a good value.

reviews.name: Lilly Juricek
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019
reviews.title: Not as expected
reviews.review_text: I recently bought this as a gift for myself for school use. The picture shows a black, sleek looking laptop. What came was a dull, gray boring laptop. I was disappointed it didn't look like what was presented. But, I figured I might as well try it out. It has been two months now, and I hate how annoying it is. It functions as a tablet with apps instead of a windows or apple configuration. My fault, I should've done more research on it. But I just want Word to work on it...and no matter what I do, it never works correctly. I'm just disappointed overall. I should've just sent it back and gotten something better. Would not recommend. Spend a little more and get a more quality product.

reviews.name: William E.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
reviews.title: Not as advertised
reviews.review_text: My first ever chrome book (have always used a PC prior to this), and bought it because the technical details indicated that this unit contained a 128 GB SSD drive - which it does not!  Very disappointed that technical details are misleading.

reviews.name: Olivia
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
reviews.title: won't connect to some printers without using Google cloud
reviews.review_text: This is very frustrating, we cannot connect to some printers we have because the operating system forces users to use Google cloud service. Would not have purchased Chromebook if I knew the ahead of time. Beware.

reviews.name: Molly L.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2018
reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.review_text: Great size and perfect for what I need to do.

reviews.name: Xavier Beguiristain
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
reviews.title: Great Chromebook
reviews.review_text: I originally bought this for my son's school but my wife stole it and will have to buy another one. I am not a fan of Chromebooks but all the schools are using them now. It is fast and if you are in the cloud for everything it is fantastic. If you are looking for software or saving docs to you laptop it is not.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
reviews.title: Not what I expected.
reviews.review_text: I thought this would be like a normal laptop.  I have trouble figuring it out.  Not real happy with it because the only thing I can seen to do like normal is get online.  Instructions on how to use are not as clear as I would like.  Making documents and accessing are not easy.  I would not recommend this but would recommend a small normal laptop were you could actually make a word document.  I bought this so I wouldn't have to always take my larger laptop.  This has not happened. Would be nice to have a user friendly manual. Size and weight good.

reviews.name: Bwill
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2018
reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.review_text: love it

reviews.name: 1CrazyLife4Me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
reviews.title: Smaller Size Which We Love
reviews.review_text: So far works very well! We purchased this to use with a drawing tablet but didn’t realize the one we bought didn’t work with Chrome Operating Systems so we are now using this as a homeschool laptop which works very well for that purpose. We love the smaller size as well. I will update if we have any issues with the it, If I don’t update than it is still working perfectly.

reviews.name: William
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
reviews.title: Good entry level chromebook
reviews.review_text: So, its not a touchscreen. That was a little disappointing because everything we use now is touchscreen. However the platform it uses is exactly like what we're used to. I didn't really understand what a Chromebook really was until I started shopping for this. I do like a Chromebook platform and will always lean towards that. For what I would use a laptop for this is sufficient. I would prefer better screen resolution and a touchscreen as well. Depending on what you plan on using it for, it will do most everything except store a bunch files on a harddrive.

reviews.name: Manish A.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
reviews.title: Great for around the house use
reviews.review_text: I have been using this Chromebook for awhile now and I like the simplicity of it. The battery life is good but if you don't turn it off and let it go to sleep the battery will drain within days even when you don't use it. Now I just turn it off when I don't use it. Overall it's great to use around the house and to have a device with a keyboard if you don't want to use a laptop. The audio quality is okay I think my 2017 iPad pro sounds way better

reviews.name: Tracy Ihle
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
reviews.title: I'd buy again
reviews.review_text: I bought this for my husband when he retired because his old laptop died.  He had to get use to it but once he did he loves it.  It's fast.  Pics are clear and crisp.  Happy hubby makes me a happy customer!

reviews.name: Zen Bunny
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
reviews.title: Absolute garbage
reviews.review_text: Was working fine for a few months, then died. It just wouldn't turn on, and would not charge. I thought it was the cord, got a new cord, same story. It's dead. After less than a year. I'm still under warranty, but since I got this at a steep discount, at this point it's more trouble to try and repair it than to simply toss it in the garbage.

reviews.name: No name given
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
reviews.title: Cheap and difficult
reviews.review_text: This is a nightmare to use. Passwords are linked to your google account so if you lose that password, you can reset it but it still insists that you use the old one, the one you lost, or you lose everything that you saved. reviews.name: Marranda Pugh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
reviews.title: "Refurbished"
reviews.review_text: Now I read some of the reviews before I just went ahead and purchased this, but I figured it would have been so bad. I had bought this laptop because it was cheap and it was for a friend of mine who didn't have one. I took a week to set it up and see what was wrong with it. When I got it, it was easy to notice some faint scratch marks on the framework on the inside, but they were not too deep. Nothing seemed too wrong with it, then I found out the right part of the mouse wouldn't work (like the right-click button) but after a week I used how to work around that. Overall, I would say it's a good buy for just $97 (plus handling).

reviews.name: Another Floyd
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2014
reviews.title: Terrific!
reviews.review_text: My refurbished C720 Chromebook with 4GB RAM looks like new [oops, I did eventually notice a small ding on a rear corner; still acceptable]. I'm very pleased with it, as a web browser, and for writing. For me, it would not be powerful and flexible enough to be my only computer, but, it is really slick, for what it is. Performance is snappy, and the user experience is very good. You do have to learn some key combos to do navigation and such. There's a really nice keyboard map, accessed by pressing CTRL-ALT-?, ready for handy reference. The trackpad is very smooth. Battery life is around the advertised 8+ hours. Since I use the unit every day, and the suspend mode is pretty easy on battery use, I haven't even turned it off... just closed the lid so that it is instant-on when I open up again. With my use patterns, I've been charging every other day. I've heard the C720 described as ugly. I disagree. It may not be the height of elegance (yes, I was blown away when I first saw a Macbook Air), but, it is really decent. My only minor niggle is that the cover finish is a magnet for oily fingerprints. I didn't fully love the Chromebook until I found the Caret app. It is a multi-document text and code editor that truly works offline. Be advised that you may hear that Google Docs and some other included Chromebook "apps" can be used offline. My own experience, and that of many, many reviewers in the Google Play store, is that those claims are often not true, or only half true, at least for now. For example Google Play Books has an option to make your book titles available offline. All that seems to do is cache 10 or 12 pages ahead, and, it is those pages you could read offline. Now, there IS an option to download books in PDF format. That works, but, you will no longer be reading with the smooth experience of the Books app. I hear you can work on a Google Docs file offline if you begin it online, or some such. I have not seen this work, in practice. None of this is criticism of Acer, but of Google and maybe some app developers. If you expect to do work offline, be prepared to find apps that will really let you do that.

reviews.name: scottjl
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2014
reviews.title: Amazing value for the cost.
reviews.review_text: I read about this laptop on a linux forum and was a bit skeptical. It took a little over a week to arrive, the 128G SSD I ordered got to me first. Played with ChromeOS for a few hours, it's come a long way since I tried it years ago, full featured for anyone looking for a simple online OS. I then proceeded to swap out the SSD, remove the firmware lock screw and install Ubuntu (there's a great version on www.distroshare.com). A few hours later I had a very speedy, full-function Ubuntu Linux laptop. Light weight and with about 7 hours of battery time, this thing really can't be beat for the price. I guess you're taking a chance with the refurb draw, but my unit was in brand new condition and everything functions fine. Note, you can not install Windows on here, any version, so don't bother trying, there are no drivers for the keyboard and mouse. If you want a low-cost, light weight, long battery life Linux laptop for web, lightweight development, and general purpose, this is a great fit. I definitely recommend this laptop with this in mind. PS. Check out Acer's web site for "Google Goodies" while you still have ChromeOS loaded. You may be able to get Google Drive space and other perks, but you MUST be in ChromeOS to claim them, not Linux.
