reviews.name: IK
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2014
reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Price
reviews.review_text: Other recommendations were to get the 4GB version of the Acer C720 and not the 2GB version. That was great advice and I am very happy with this Chromebook so far. The 16GB SSD is good enough unless you really need to add lots of apps. For multimedia, if you don't want to store it in the cloud then just get a fast USB 3.0 memory stick, 32 or 64GB. The battery life is exceptional. The WiFi is very fast to connect and has excellent data speeds. This item was refurbished and definitely like brand new. I would recommend Acer refurbished products to anyone. Also, even though it is refurbished, Google still gave me the free 100GB of storage for 2 years. The only reason I don't give this product a 5 star is that some of the normal keys on the Chromebook keyboard are missing, such as Delete. You have to learn the muti-key replacements for these, such as CTRL-Backspace for Delete. That is annoying as there seems to be room in the form factor for these keys to exist. I also have had problems with the right mouse button functioning in some programs and I am not sure why. This may be a Chrome OS issue.

reviews.name: Kathie Henley
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2019
reviews.title: Unhappy with product.
reviews.review_text: The ad described it as refurbished but said it would be in good condition with minimal wear and tear. It arrived looking trashed imo. In addition to the scratches and worn off pain on the keyboard area it also has a large blemish on the screen. I haven’t had a chance to try it out yet but if it preforms like it looks it was a total waste of money.

reviews.name: k8t3469
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2019
reviews.title: Great for the price
reviews.review_text: This is perfect for what I need it for and you can't beat the price it was worth every penny. It holds a great charge, Minor scrapes or scratchesI there's nothing wrong with a screen, nothing wrong with the buttons, nothing wrong with the speed. I have no complaints for what I paid for this.

reviews.name: Jules
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
reviews.title: Beyond disappointed
reviews.review_text: Second computer I bought off amazon in 3 days. Forst one ( Samsung version of chromebook) shut off within seconds of using. This one was dirty and nobody signed off of their enterprise account. I have work to get done for my business. Amazon is 0 for 2 with me. My work is beyond delayed. They sent me a piece of garbage with sticker residue all over it and its locked and wont let me in (which tells me they did nothing to fix it) save yourself the headache and buy one in person.

reviews.name: Leo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
reviews.title: Missing back plate screw's
reviews.review_text: Never had one will take a little getting use to I know it's used but in really good shape do have one question the tiny screws that hold it together I notice there are only four in place on each corner eight are missing , do you know where I can get these to pit in don't like the idea of only four holding it together.

reviews.name: 7TR3Y7
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
reviews.title: End of Google Updates
reviews.review_text: I suppose I should have done more research on this item for purchasing it considering this Chromebook is no longer supported by Google, meaning it no longer receives any update; however, for a netbook it's decent in processing speed.  I believe it may end up in better use in Dev mode for running Linux. Update: Yes definitely better after upgrading the SSD, after trial and error it seems to handle Linux Mint 32bit 18.3.  Yes I know its a 64bit; however, I tried both and to get optimum use from that Intel processor 32bit functions much better, plus it still supports the intel display driver which you want.  It's a great little system with the larger m5 ssd.

reviews.name: DrNorm
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2014
reviews.title: 3 People, 6 Desktops, but I needed something portable
reviews.review_text: I needed a portable computer to replace a 6 year old acer that was in disrepair but was unsure of getting a Chromebook.  I considered an HP 11, Acer C720 and Toshiba.  With each additional piece of information I visited my Best Buy to get a sense of how each one would provide the functionality.  For me the deciding factor was the two-fold - 4gb ram and a relatively low price. I also had to feel comfortable with the fact that this is a refurbished laptop and I didn't know what impact that would have in the long run.  It has been a month now and I am happy with the purchase.  I cannot say for sure whether 4 gb allows me to do more but I can tell you that I have never worried about how many tabs I had open or doing anything else with the Chromebook.  So it works for me.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
reviews.title: MAJOR cosmetic damage, no updates remaining, not a quality refurb!
reviews.review_text: This was shipped with care, with huge bubble wrap surrounding the laptop BUT that doesn't erase the damage that was clearly present before packaging it up and sending it out refurbished. There were MAJOR scratches and gashes all over this piece. I was not expecting perfection but this is the second laptop I've purchased refurbished and did NOT expect this amount of cosmetic damage at all. The laptop also did not come equipped with apps to download anything additional, was not at all user friendly, immediately gave us a notice that there was a recent update done and it was the final update available for this device and no more would be available, and with all this combined with the damage we decided to return. I was so upset with the purchase I didn't even have the umph to take pictures to add to this review. This was meant to be a cheap, easy, first laptop for my 6 year old to do her homework on but it wouldn't have even had enough options available for her to do that efficiently.

reviews.name: armymomoftwo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent for homeschooling!
reviews.review_text: I wish I had thought to look for these sooner, they have been excellent for our homeschooling family! We bought three, and at less than $100 each, it was very affordable. I would have given it 10 stars for this if I could! You can tell they are refurbished... There are a few scratches and scuffs on the outside, and one power cord is different than the others. But it's nothing that gets in the way of the functionality. (And honestly, since I bought these for my small children, I'm sure they will add their own scratches pretty quickly.) I charge them every night, then unplug them for use during our school day. I haven't had any problem with the battery life. They are really lightweight so I'm not worried about my kids dropping them. They also have a headphone jack, which really comes in handy. We use internet based school materials, so I haven't tried to use anything like Word, although I've heard you can use that on these if you need to. My only issue is that I really wish I could connect these to our printer. However, I think the problem with that lies with our printer, not the Chromebooks. I love these Chromebooks and will definitely purchase more as more of our children start reaching school age.

reviews.name: Candace
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
reviews.title: It sucks
reviews.review_text: The software can’t run anything! It can’t run Java, Minecraft, or even Skype. Absolutely terrible. The only thing this laptop can do is browse the web and play YouTube videos. And it is pretty fast for web browsing, I have to give it one star instead of zero for this reason alone. To boot, when I tried to set it back to factory setting so I could send it back, this creepy thing took a photo of me... the flash went off and everything. Only get this laptop if you need to browse the web but don’t buy it for anything else. I can’t even uninstall the chromebook software and install Microsoft Windows software on it because it’s a google laptop... Absolutely terrible purchase.

reviews.name: Brianne
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2019
reviews.title: Crappy looking but kinda does the job.
reviews.review_text: *Update: more keys stopped working and i sent it back with a full refund. I mainly needed this for school and to use google Docs. Worked great for those things. The shift key seems to have aome problems so im more annoyed with that than all the problems on the outside. Its a complete mess on the outside. Broken pieces include part of a vent, one of the usb ports, and crumbs? Shoved into the HDMI port. Thankfully i really do not need these to do my work. Called amazon and got a partial refund and keeping the computer.

reviews.name: AmazonShopper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
reviews.title: decent for that price
reviews.review_text: battery only lasts 4hrs and the cord is overly bulky for such a small machine. it seems like the track pad only clicks when you want it to like 80% of the time and it gets slow sometimes but it was like 90 bucks so I can't complain too much. was a replacement for another cheap chromebook. had it a few weeks so far. hope it holds up. *update* I've had it a few weeks and its just gone black and shut down on me for no reason two or three times. And it seems to lag online a lot more than my previous chromebook which was an Asus. It was cheap, but I would buy something different next time. I like the Asus better. UPDATE: less than 3 months later.. it will just randomly shut OFF for no reason. would not recommend buying this if this is going to be a problem.

reviews.name: lydia quick
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
reviews.title: Brocken charger
reviews.review_text: Got this product today was so excited because it’s a wedding anaversery gift and when we opened it to charge it the charger was broken now I have a laptop with a broken charger that amazon can’t replace. I understand that buying from 3rd party’s is at your own risk. I am super upset that this happened.

reviews.name: Rainyj
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
reviews.title: Battery not holding charge
reviews.review_text: I bought this as a backup while my laptop is being repaired that is under warranty. I only had the one computer. I received  this yesterday 08/07/19 set it to charge overnight.  I turned on,logged in - took power cable connect out. This computer shutdown immediately. It says the battery life is supposed to be 8.5 hours. Since this is refurbished I thought they would at least replace the battery and right now I can't even find where that is.  I was intending on using this to study courses out of my home but now it appears I cannot.  I may return it right now I need until my other one is received back.

reviews.name: Julie
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
reviews.title: Fan is LOUD
reviews.review_text: This is a great replacement for my other, full laptop for a good price. It's lightweight, and very minimalist, which I personally like since I don't need to do much other than get on the internet and occasionally use the Google Drive, BUT the fan is so LOUD! I jokingly call it my jet engine. I shut it down every time I'm not using it because the fan is so ridiculous. Might be worth looking at another option that doesn't have such fan issues.

reviews.name: Amanda C.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020
reviews.title: Not a touchscreen
reviews.review_text: I bought this laptop for my 6 year old son (1st grade) to do his school work while they’re out for the COVID-19 quarantine and it arrive today and is already being put to good use.  I didn’t give it a 5 star bc the description says touchscreen and it is not a touchscreen.  It’s serving it’s purpose for us though, so we will keep it.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2019
reviews.title: It just stopped working......
reviews.review_text: There are so many things wrong with this purchase, to the point where renewed ( or even refurbished) is an extreme stretch. Initially looking at it I thought that the several screws missing, bumps, and scratches on the side were worrying but I reassured myself based on the fact that it was only cosmetic and wouldn't  affect performance. However, less than two days using the product (28 hrs to be precise) the screen fizzed out and now it won't turn on. This is a terrible product and even worse is the "Renewed" so generously given to it by its sellers.

reviews.name: Trisha Bennett
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
reviews.title: Looks new
reviews.review_text: I always have problems deciding to go with the high reviews or low.  I really needed a small computer that would fit in my purse when I travel and this does.  Mine looks brand new and I was able to sign in and use within minutes.  I charged computer for close to an hour and battery was full.  I would buy another renewed computer after this.  My thinking was for the price I could return if it wasn't what they said.  update  I had to buy a charger because the one they gave wasn't charging.  I love the computer.

reviews.name: Bradley D Strausbagh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent value at this price point
reviews.review_text: I am very happy with this little Chromebook.  Good ergonomics - i.e. good keyboard interaction and responsive touch pad.  I like the mat screen because of the reduction in glare although the viewing angle is a bit narrow, but not to the point of being a problem.  Starting with a full battery charge I did about six and a half hours of text editing with periodic saves to the cloud (and the battery probably could have made it to seven hours).  I am a total newbie with the Chrome OS so forgive my naive gushing but I am very impressed with this whole thin-client paradigm.  And I love the C720's small, light form factor.  Just throw it in your backpack and it's always there when you need it.  I added a 128GB stubby thumb drive for off-line situations.  And I could sync with my existing Linux-friendly Dropbox account which I did not want to give up for Linux-hating Google Drive.  I know with "renewed" items, there is an element of chance but in my case it worked out.  I know money can't buy happiness but this $86 got me pretty close.

reviews.name: RS SURPLUS LLC
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2014
reviews.title: Amazing Performance & Bang 4 Buck!
reviews.review_text: This is an amazing little machine. Even more amazing as a Linux laptop. I purchased refurbished on Amazon and I have to say, it was worth every penny! Item is in excellent condition, came in a plain box with the charger. No additional documentation or waste, very minimal packaging. Nothing unexpected. Good stuff. I have a confession to make; I used to avoid Celeron processors like the plague. The 2955U Intel Haswell processor used here is quite speedy and has changed my view on Celerons completely. You will not be disappointed. Day-to-day performance has been excellent; this can play 1080P HD video and multitask without any hiccups. Forget ARM processors (too slow), forget the Core i3 model (offers minor improvement); this is where it's at. The 4GB of RAM I feel definitely kicks it up a notch and helps any overall operating system handle better. The SSD is fast and very responsive, even for a small size of 16GB. After repartitioning for a Linux install, I had around 4GB to play around with after installing all of my essentials, even after including updates. For any of those who are wondering, the SSD is upgradable, but the RAM is soldered in. This laptop is great on power / battery life, and has never gotten warm except when charging under intensive use; very lap friendly. WiFi and Bluetooth are great and have had no problems. The 720p webcam is good as well and the design is simple and stylish in grey. Easy to take apart and put back together, as it uses standard screws, all of which are located on the bottom of the unit itself. Minor gripes. The screen is subpar and isn't the sharpest or best quality. It's got a bright backlight, but the color representation is not as saturated. Another thing is that the keyboard feels kinda plastic / cheap in my opinion. It feels lighter than usual to me, but that's pretty much it. Not really much to complain about, that I won't even take away a star. Overall, this is an amazing little machine for the price. Chrome OS is pretty basic, as to be expected. However, I've purchased with the exclusive purpose of installing Linux in mind. Linux has now opened up a world of possibilities with using this device, including using Skype! If you're thinking about purchasing this to hack and put Linux on it, I would highly recommend the 4GB RAM option to anyone. This is one of the best selling Chromebooks for a reason, and it definitely gets the job done. It's the best bang for the buck that you can find around these price ranges. Overall the device feels solidly put together and I'm very happy with the direction that Acer went with this.

reviews.name: HR
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
reviews.title: Spend the extra cash and get a new one.
reviews.review_text: I bought this knowing that I was going to get a beat up Chromebook. I was ready to accept that. This was going to be used by my daughter who's in elementary school therefore not a whole lot is needed from a Chromebook. But this one in particular arrived and the trackpad didn't work. It was all jumpy and completely unusable. Another thing I didn't see in the description before I bought it was the fact that these are at the end of their "life" and there is no more software support or updates for it. So you get what you get and you're stuck with it because Google is no longer providing updates for this version. Needless to say, I am returning it and buying a new one. Hope this helps.

reviews.name: Megan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
reviews.title: Not a bad deal for something simple
reviews.review_text: I specifically bought this laptop because I wanted something cheap I could take places with me and not worry about my main MacBook that I use to do my professional work stuff on.  The package came a week early, which was a great bonus, and so far seems to be working well.  I had no trouble connecting it to my Google account and my other two devices.  I bought a model marked as "Fair," so I was expecting some dings.  The caps button doesn't work, but the shift button is easy enough to use instead.  There are some scratches on the body of the laptop, but nothing on the screen or touchpad so it really doesn't effect how the laptop works.  Very lightweight and easy to take places.  It's a very basic, simple laptop that is great if you just want something to work on Google Docs and maybe surf the internet with.  It seems to be holding a charge well, and it was easy to customize the settings on it.  Overall, thus far, it seems to be a really good deal for what you get.  I definitely would not use this as my main computer, but it's nice throwaway item to take around with you.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
reviews.title: The perfect sized laptop for at home or on the go
reviews.review_text: Perfect size for me or my kids to handle, its basically like having a large tablet with a keyboard and that's exactly what I wanted. I really was surprised how well it looks for a refurbished item with only a few Knicks on the corners but the keyboard and screen looks brand new, the battery lasted a few hours as I was able to connect it to wifi and download a few apps through the play store just like my phone. I purchased so my kids can type up any projects they need and also so I can work on some books I have been typing on my phone and I'm sure this will be able to do anything I need it to do. No disc drive but that every chromebook I've ever seen so dont be disappointed.

reviews.name: john j nova
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
reviews.title: So so disappointed 😔😢😔😢
reviews.review_text: Purchased renewed. Looks like a old scratched up unit that has been dragged down the street. Should of been scrapped. Not labeled renewed. I'm so disappointed and embarrassed. Was a Christmas gift. Made me look like a p.o.s . Not happy at all.  I'm now the Grinch who killed Christmas.

reviews.name: Dale Wolford
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
reviews.title: Refurbished Acer Laptop
reviews.review_text: For a refurbished Laptop I am Very pleased if not Amazed. This Laptop was up and running in just under 5 minutes. With it having Google Chrome in was quickly able to Sync up all my Google services and surf the net in under 10 Minutes. I will update this again after I have used it for a week or 2 to give more info. If anyone is curious about purchasing 1 you can feel free to Email me directly @ DaleWolford2065@gmail.com and I will give you my honest feedback.

reviews.name: Derrick Anderson
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
reviews.title: The best Chromebook out there
reviews.review_text: When it comes to computers, Acer is a company that provides the best computers for people who want speed. But when it comes to performance, Acer's Chromebook is the one laptop that provides the best performance. When you first turn on the device, the device will show the Chrome logo. About two to four seconds after it cuts on, you are directed to a log-in screen where you enter the password for your Gmail email address. From there, you are on your way to using a laptop that will not only become your new favorite laptop, but one that is sure to be a keeper. I ordered this Acer laptop via Amazon Renewed and was kind of skeptical about this one. But when I got it, everything worked out just fine and has become the best laptop I have ever used. The laptop came with a Lenovo charger which works out just fine. If you need a laptop that has the best in Google services as well as great performance, please get your hands on this Acer Chromebook, because it is a laptop worth buying.

reviews.name: Manny A.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2015
reviews.title: I'm generallly happy with my purchase
reviews.review_text: After a few hours working with this refurbished C720, I'm generallly happy with my purchase.  It is pretty much what I expected of a laptop for $209 and for what I plan to do with it, its good enough.  Despite being a factory refurbished model, it looks and feels brand new.  I couldn't find any evidence of wear and tear.  The keyboard isn't perfect, but certainly usable -- it feels cheap, but not crappy cheap.  The case is somewhat flimsy -- when you lift it from the bottom while the fan is running, the bottom of the case comes into contact with the spinning fan -- knowing that is an issue, I'll take care not to do it again.  Despite the caveat that redeeming the 100GB of Google might not work, I was pleasantly surpised that I was given a whole TERABYTE for two years!  Yes I said a TERABYTE!!!

reviews.name: rosemary crockett
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
reviews.title: Price is excellent
reviews.review_text: I do enjoy Chromebooks and this is our second. There are obvious drawbacks with the Google/droid environment but we were aware. Such as not being able to run Windoze programs like TurboTax for instance but it gets most things done and it's very quick to load. For some data mining by Google is a concern but heck we just don't care.  For the money, this can't be beaten. I would highly recommend for a student on a budget.

reviews.name: Dorothy Z
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
reviews.title: Screen blinks.  Cannot
reviews.review_text: Doesn't work. Screen just blinks every few seconds upon setup. Seller includes a "don't return, call us first" pamphlet in the box because I'm sure they don't want a bad review. Certified refurbished is a joke in this case. Very disappointed.

reviews.name: Ross Brown
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Product
reviews.review_text: I bought two of these for my kids to use for the Coronavirus quarantine online school.  I bought them because they were the least expensive ones I could find, but they should have cost much less than I paid.  They both look like someone found them in a dumpster.  Do not buy this item.  I never write reviews, but I wanted to let everyone know that they should spend the extra money to get a new one.  Very frustrating!!

reviews.name: JoYo Knighthawk
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020
reviews.title: Great value
reviews.review_text: This thing is awesome. Saved a bunch of money buying refurb and it works great. Never wanted a Chromebook but my new hp was going to take a month to ship so I wanted something quick and cheap. This made me want to switch to Chromebooks. Battery lasts forever and it's super lightweight. If you have never used a Chromebook it's definitely different than windows. Once you adjust it's good to go.

reviews.name: Patricia Sohns
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
reviews.title: Nice little chrome book
reviews.review_text: I wanted to write a review. I have never owned a little laptop or chrome book but it is great. I have to get used to operating it but YouTube has helped with that. The refurbished products I have bought on Amazon have been great. I have never had a problem with them. All I can say is it is a very nice little chrome book and I am really enjoying learning all that it is capable of doing. And the price can not be beat. Thanks

reviews.name: Alex
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2014
reviews.title: Great for lightweight laptop used for connecting remotely to other machines
reviews.review_text: Small and lightweight. I'm a physics graduate student and this is perfect for bringing along with me. My work involves coding and running software on various machines though not my laptop. For anyone who is unsure about storage space and working offline there are a few things you can do. If you consider yourself handy you can open up the Chromebook and replace the small SSD with a larger one. I used http://www.amazon.com/MyDigitalSSD-Super-Cache-Solid-State/dp/B00EZ2E8NO and it works great and was easy to install. For offline work you can switch to developer mode and install crouton. This will allow you to run ChromeOS and switch into a version of Linux. This is not dual booting; Linux will be run from ChromeOS.

reviews.name: Michaela
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
reviews.title: Can’t stream Netflix or Disney Plus
reviews.review_text: I purchased the computer for two reasons, one was to watch Netflix and Disney plus and the other to do PowerPoint. For PowerPoint it works fine because i can use google slides BUT it doesn’t tell you that it is not compatible with Netflix and Disney plus. I can log in but it won’t play movies or shows. Since that is 90% of the reason i purchased the computer, I’m a little disappointed. I don’t know much about computers so i wish it was more clear in the description about what it can be used for. Maybe a line about “not compatible with most online streaming services” would be useful.

reviews.name: Brandon Carmack
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: If I could give 0 stars, I would. This product was nice to look at, but that's all. I bought this as a gift for my daughter, and she was understandably disappointed. This laptop is out of date and came up with a warning sign that it would no longer be updated. Google play was not on the laptop itself, therefore we could not download any apps. She wanted this laptop for roblox, but couldn't even download it or play it on the website being that it was outdated. Waste of money. Look elsewhere

reviews.name: ALAN H. KENNEDY
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019
reviews.title: No software updates.
reviews.review_text: After connecting to wireless network the first message is that Google no longer provides security updates for this Chromebook. Chromebooks can only be updated for 5 years after manufacture/purchase although the label indicated a manufacture date in 2018.  It can be used used but the device cannot be secured against data and information theft. Use at your own risk. Immediately returned.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
reviews.title: Will mostly work well but don’t expect like or near new condition
reviews.review_text: Update: upon initial review and message to seller, they quickly responded and offered to return. Due to distance learning for my daughter we needed the malito and kept it. The charger died on us yesterday and upon contacting them, they immediately sent a replacement. Overall great service, would consider using them again based on how they’re doing responded just be advised that units may have seen more use than described. Knowingly bought a refurbished unit for my daughter to use for distance learning.  Item was described and fully functioning. Upon receipt found one usb drive does not work, microphone does not work either, and charger is extremely hot when being used. Until works great otherwise. Did reach out to seller and pending response.

reviews.name: Itsme!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
reviews.title: Obsolete before I even turned on
reviews.review_text: It said reconditioned but there were scuff marks that could have been removed before shipping which was a bad first impression. What made it worse was when I turned it on and immediately received a message from google that the device software could not be updated, ever, it’s obsolete and the notice even encourages you to upgrade to a new device. I didn’t notice this in the description and don’t know enough about operations systems to have known this based on the specs so am only letting others like myself know. They did accept s return when I sent it back for refund the next day.

reviews.name: nick
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
reviews.review_text: Got it and open it up charged it and it is a fast very clean  what is a refurbished computer but does not show any signs of wear scratches Computer Works flawless have had many Acer products always satisfied

reviews.name: Mary Leehy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
reviews.title: Good product and a good price
reviews.review_text: Since I bought this for my 7 year granddaughter, I wanted something easy to use, lightweight and with a long battery life. This laptop met all my expectations. My granddaughter loves it and is able to use it by herself to make videos and play games. It was a great value for the money. I am very happy with my purchase.

reviews.name: Beau Bramblett
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
reviews.title: Broken when arrived.
reviews.review_text: My laptop just arrived today and is missing the second part of the charger and the laptop is coming apart because it’s not screwed together. I can hear the inside of the laptop moving around.

reviews.name: Brenda
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
reviews.title: the battery works lengthy but not for continous video view
reviews.review_text: the laptop is very cool. i bought it cause i just needed a laptop to study online and make simple papers. it still works for me it doeesnt freeze up. it hasnt heat up either, it doesnt have a CDROM. the battery is good and last long unless you use this laptop for video watching then it will only give about 3 hours of steady watching until it dies. but it charges quickly. the webcam works great. its a great starter laptop for those who needs a simple laptop for daily use

reviews.name: Carl Brothers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019

reviews.review_text: This chromebook is AMAZING!  Great for web browsing and productivity. Battery life is amazing and mirror & extend desktop over HDMI is great for presentations or increasing productivity.  The keyboard keys have a great clicky-ness to them and a good layout for quick typing.  Great laptop for a blogger, copy writer or website/content manager. Free shipping and it arrived a day after I ordered. The only con I found is that the SD card slot is not a spring loaded slot that hides the whole card.  It sticks out about halfway.  I found this to be a huge bummer because I planned on expanding the storage with a high speed sd card.  Not a deal breaker though.  I would be this again. PS.  If you're comparing to an ARM(Samsung Exynos) based Chromebook, do some research.  The ARM processors don't have as much power as the numbers would leave you believe.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2014
reviews.title: I am satisfied
reviews.review_text: Sweet laptop for my application.  I put a 128 GB SSD, installed Arch Linux on it and it runs great.  The best part is that it still gets 7+ hours on one battery charge.  There are some software bugs (like suspend and touchpad) with a Linux install but the benefits out weight the issues for me.  Before this I had the 2gb Acer c720 and kept chromeOS on it.  ChromeOS is a fine OS if you only need to create documents, check mail, and browse the web.  For me I needed compilers, a stable text editor, and some other software dev tools not offered in the ChromeOS software suite.  On ChromeOS I got 8+ hours battery life and good performance (dozens of tabs open).  All and all a great machine and a great deal.

reviews.name: Nerd Alert
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2019
reviews.title: Mediocre Corporate Style Laptop
reviews.review_text: You may, like me, have been one of those people standing in line on some Black Friday waiting for a super cheap laptop.  After winning your prize, you went home and realized that it was still not a good deal.  This laptop is almost in that category, though the build quality keeps it above water. It is important to start by discussing Windows 10 S.  It is a very restricted version of Windows 10 that allows only official apps to be installed, like the Edge web browser and Microsoft Office, plus restricts some multitasking.  There are different reasons for it to exist, including corporate/business use, to prevent unauthorized apps and avoid viruses.  It is also reportedly aimed at low end devices, being a lightweight version of the operating system more in line with a Chromebook.  This was my first experience with it, so I went in with an open mind... Everything seemed laggy and slow.  Isn't Windows 10 S supposed to be fast?  Sometimes a new computer is downloading and installing updates in the background, which makes it feel slow.  I checked and the computer was up to date.  The internet on my home Wifi, which works fine for everything else, was spotty.  The web browser would sometimes work slowly and other times not at all.  I quickly realized, also, that nearly everything I do on a computer is not accessible in Windows 10 S.  I browse the web in the Brave browser, which I couldn't install.  I watch movies in VLC.  So, I decided to "upgrade" to standard Windows 10 home, which is free, but the page for that kept stalling out. After giving the laptop a day off and taking it to work to try a different network on the older band (802.11g), Windows successfully switched off of S mode.  Annoyingly, I was required to use a Microsoft account to do that.  I checked and suddenly there were a ton of updates that I could install.  After doing so, the laptop was 500% faster, even if it was still on the slower side.  It also worked fine on my home network.  Do not believe the warnings that pop up about it slowing the computer down to switch.  I also went into power settings and turned off GPU throttling, which is a trick hardware makers play to give better battery life estimates at the cost of performance.  After downloading my preferred browser and software, I was able to browse the web and stream video fine.  I tried using the HDMI port, but it would not allow me to use the monitor.  Some glitch seems to happen, which may be related to the monitor having HDR support.  Normally, a computer that does not support HDR will just output non-HDR and it will work fine, but something strange was happening with the settings vanishing.  When that failed after a lot of tinkering, I tried Miracast (wireless display casting) and that actually worked with just a little lag, but it cuts out after maybe 20 minutes each time. The screen is very outdated.  Apart from the lower resolution, which I can live with, the viewing angles require very direct aiming of the screen at the viewer.  If I try to look at the screen when I am standing up, it looks all washed out.  Coming out in 2019, this is not acceptable on even a cheap laptop. Overall build quality, for the low price, is not bad at all.  It has a business laptop look that is not offensive and is more sturdy than some in this price range.  The charger is the traditional block type rather than the handy USB-C.  There are no USB-C ports at all. As many faults as this laptop has, it could be worth purchasing at a very low price, rather than the current pretty low price.  If you just need some light browsing (not on a monitor or a good screen) and can deal with the headaches of the OS, I could see it having merit.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
reviews.title: I was happy at first BUT
reviews.review_text: I was happy with this at first it seemed to work really we it was quick clear and sort of fast, very good for the price I paid. But then there started to have problems. I got this on November 30th late November 30th at that so because of the scheduling I had I wasn't able to even use it until the first of December it is now the seventeen just a little over two weeks after I got this and the entire thing crashed on me. Even when I was being very careful about how I used it, and made sure to shut it down when it wasn't in use. I never dropped it, never fell to the ground and didn't spill anything on it. I closed it just the previous night so I could do some work that would take me only a couple of minutes and when I got back it wouldn't turn on at all. It is and was fully charged, but I left ti alone and let it charge over night just to be sure but it still will not turn on. If I had known this was going to happen or it was only going to last as long as it did, I would have waited a bit longer and spend a bit more on another brand of computer. This computers seeing as I wasn't doing any heavy gaming or anything remotely close to that, but reading and listening to light music isn't worth it cost and will likely crash for anyone who wants to get some heavy work done on it like school work or other similar things. I would suggest not to get this, or if you do be prepared to go to a computer repair shop not long after getting it like I am.

reviews.name: R S Cobblestone
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
reviews.title: Plagued with problems, especially after leaving S Mode...
reviews.review_text: When I started using this laptop, I was really looking for a laptop for school and work.  I wanted a no-frills, cheapish machine that would be able to run Microsoft Word, a few tabs in a browser, and some very light programming and CAD work. This laptop is able to do so, but only by the skin of its teeth.  It must be noted that it comes with Windows S, a locked operating system somewhat reminiscent of Chrome OS, where non-certified apps are restricted, and the laptop's performance is thus protected from strain.  The moment I had the laptop set up, I reverted it to normal Windows 10 Home and that is when the seams started to show. From startup to shut down, no matter what I am asking of the CPU, the Intel Celeron N4000 remains at 100% load.  It is chugging…one hundred percent of the time.  RAM usage sits at around 80%, regardless of task or program in use.  There are noticeable delays when trying to open programs or browser tabs, forget CAD work.  This may be partially my fault, since the laptop is designed for a Windows S environment, but an outdated CPU tied to 4 GB of RAM will always struggle, regardless of the environment.  HP may have tried to alleviate this by giving the laptop a very low-quality screen, where even normal text is often slightly pixelated. The 64 eMMC storage is fine…if you are using some cloud service for the majority of your storage (the laptop comes with one year of 1 TB of OneDrive storage).  Don’t expect to store movies or install many programs on this laptop. A mark in this laptop's favor is the three USB-A ports, one of which is USB 2.0 and the other two of which are 3.1 Gen 1.  It also has a full-sized HDMI port, which I have already used many times in the office.  It has no USB-C port, unlike most modern laptops, but, somewhat hilariously, neither does a single projector or TV in my office.  For better or for worse, they all still have HDMI cords and I have been asked many times to use my underpowered laptop over co-workers modern workhorses simply because of that HDMI port! I don’t mind this laptop, with its huge bezels, bad camera, and outdated Wi-Fi antenna.  I have had to drastically change my expectations, but I never worry about it getting beat up on my commute or damaged when I drop my backpack to the ground. It does what I ask of it, barely, and that is just fine.  Oh, and it will be the laptop I take with me on my next overseas project.  If it gets destroyed or lost... I won't cry too hard.

reviews.title: Misreported Wifi capability
reviews.review_text: The description for this laptop claims that it has 802.11a/c wifi, which would be capable of a much faster 5GHz band connection. But when I started the laptop and checked the wifi properties it was 802.11n, which only runs on a 2.4GHz, highly throttled connection. reviews.name: Rogers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
reviews.title: Setup, Video, Audio, Speed  = BOOO!
reviews.review_text: My first HP in a long time... I was ready for some pains of inconvenience, but nothing like this! Purchased to replace a 10-yo Windows7 Dell Laptop with the sole dedicated purpose of connecting to Family TV via HDMI, maybe some light surfing. Setup was not intuitive and more invasive than others I have purchased more recently.  Creating other profiles (non-Admin) required creating a distinct online ID?!  PC made it feel like a serious crime to even attempt to even consider downloading Chrome to watch YouTube TV (YouTube TV requirement). When I finally finished basic setup, I plugged in the same HDMI cable that I have been using incident free with my 'old' laptop.  It did not properly recognize my 55" Panasonic TV's size, and did not ever detect the Audio.  Within 15 minutes, I was able to adjust the size to show approximately all of the desktop, but the top and bottom were still cutoff.  HDMI Audio, however, was never detected.  I spent 2 hours going through troubleshooting guides - HP site + various forums- but none seemed to list dropdowns/guidelines that matched up closely enough to what the laptop listed. The video connection was subpar, also.  Several delays to mouse response and pixelating. I will give it one more go with a call to HP, but the has been a lot more time consuming and frustrating than it should be. Than goodness I am still within return window!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent Entry level Laptop
reviews.review_text: First of all, I LOVE HP products and have stuck with them over the past 10 years, as I’ve had many of the other big brands which have seriously disappointed. Last year, I purchased a similarly priced HP laptop for a friend who had never used a computer and wanted to learn. For the price it was adequate, but looked childish and was housed in aqua blue plastic. It worked fine, not a huge amount of power, and was fairly slow, but I figured for the low price, was good enough to start out with it. The difference between that model and this one is immense. This one, looks like a business laptop, it’s super lightweight and even though it has only 4GB of Ram, it’s fast enough. This is also the perfect Laptop for my retired Husband who really doesn’t do much computing. He sends the odd Email, checks sports scores, may stream a rare Netflix show, and plays solitaire. He also spills drinks into expensive laptop keyboards, and renders them “fried”. This is not a workhorse like my current HP Envy, but as a 1st Laptop for a child, inexperienced user, messy Husband, or more Elderly person who wants to learn, it’s a perfect stepping stone.

reviews.name: Fu Yong
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
reviews.title: A perfect laptop for light gamers provided you know computer a bit
reviews.review_text: What a great laptop for its built quality and performance. But you need to tweak a few things to maximise gaming performance: - Purchase another 8GB memory for dual channel - Set UMA buffer size to be auto in BIOS (this gives 2GB video memory in case it needs). You can use 512M if you want. - In GeForce control panel, use GTX for both 3D settings and PhysX. - In power options, set everything to be max performance for both battery and AC (3 options in total). - Install latest AMD and GTX drivers, and upgrade to Windows 1903 latest update that resolved a power option related bug that can limit CPU performance. Enjoy the awesome laptop from ASUS.

reviews.name: Paul K
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019
reviews.title: Great Gaming Laptop Value
reviews.review_text: I've been testing this laptop out for a few days now, and overall it's been great. My usage for this is 70% regular computer work (business, light Photoshop, web browsing, etc.) and 30% gaming when I travel as I have a full size gaming rig at home. I bought the  FX505DU, which has the 3750H and the 1660ti. I like the form factor and aesthetics of the device, it doesn't have much flex or "creakiness" to it, and it looks great sitting on a desk. The RGB keyboard is a great touch, but wouldn't allow me to change the color until I downloaded an extra piece of software. It cycles through all the colors by default. Other than that everything worked right out of the box and the performance has been very good. The 1660ti is a beast and has destroyed anything and everything I've thrown at it in 1080p. The 3750H cpu has been good as well, though as expected with Ryzen in some CPU intensive games it gets more than it can handle. Assassin's Creed Odyssey is a great example. I can play at ultra at 1080p with a locked 30FPS framerate, but if I attempt to get a steady 60fps on any settings, including the lowest, there's just too much going on and it can't do it, even with plenty of GPU headroom. Athens just melts it. Having said that Athens pushes my desktop 9900k, so I don't consider it a negative, just something to keep in mind if you're wanting 1080p60 on everything. The only other games I've tested so far are: The Witcher 3: Steady 60fps on ultra (had to dial back one setting, "foliage" to high, and no hairworks). Great experience. Doom 2016: All ultra locked 60 fps using less than 50% of the GPU and CPU. This title can play at 100fps, but it gets too choppy in some high intensity spots, so I lock it to 60 for a smoother experience. Thermals are great, GPU never exceeded 71c at 100% usage, no throttling that i was aware of. Make sure fans are on Turbo, which can be done with a touch of a button on the keyboard, which is awesome. The noise levels during normal usage are fairly quiet, and I appreciate that it has a silent fan setting that can dial things back in case you don't want to let everyone in the classroom or office know you're rocking a gaming rig. Noise levels during gaming were loud, but I've certainly heard much worse from other gaming laptops. I also appreciate that the top of the laptop doesn't get hot, even after prolonged gaming sessions, so you can rest your hands on the keyboard without discomfort. The screen is decent, nothing amazing, but perfectly serviceable, especially considering the price. The 120hz refresh rate is nice for regular usage, but in gaming I've found that the CPU can't get many games past 80-90fps before hitting it's limit, so I've been staying with a locked 60. Also be aware this screen doesn't have any type of adaptive refresh rate (Freesync/Gysnc) so make sure to use Vsync and a frame rate limiter if you want locked frame rates as very few newer games can hit the native 120. This model comes with 2 drives, an SSD and a mechanical hdd. I replaced the hdd with a Samsung Evo ssd, and it took about 5 minutes. The entire bottom comes off the machine after removing all the bottom screws and carefully popping the bottom panel off. I recommend using a plastic separator tool to avoid damage, the tabs were a bit too snug to pop off with just fingers. You also have access to the fans and ram in case you ever need to service and/or clean the dust out. Other than McAfee there isn't much bloatware and the preloaded Asus apps work fairly well. The keyboard and track pad are both comfy and work well. The track pad may turn some people off because it doesn't have separate left/right buttons, but it's large and responsive which is all that I look for. Overall I'm very satisfied with this laptop. It looks great, performs very well, especially considering the price, and feels very durable. My one criticism is the lack of adaptive refresh rate tech, but at this price point that's wishful thinking. Great laptop, definitely recommended.

reviews.name: JZ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
reviews.title: Solid Gaming - Premiere Pro Laptop.
reviews.review_text: Overall a terrific value for a gaming laptop. The GTX 1650 4Gb video card runs just a tad slower than a GTX 1060. Amd Ryzen 5 processor with 4-core is ample for gaming and HD editing in Premiere Pro. 8Gb of ram wasn’t enough for my apps, so I ordered an additional 8Gb stick for the available slot. See photos for model number of the Samsung stick. The case is light yet stiff plastic, keyboard and trackpad are not bad. I’ve had more expensive laptops with worse. 2nd 2.5 hard drive bay for expanded storage. The standout spec is the 120hz display, overall it looks great for gaming and editing. Some might pick on its color specs, nits, however ASUS includes a nice app to adjust to your liking. Overall wish I would have found this sooner, I’ve wanted a mobile gamer and light editing system for travel. This fits perfectly for my on the go needs.

reviews.name: Cecil Smith
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
reviews.title: Read before you buy not recommended
reviews.review_text: Not worth the time or money and especially not for gaming. First I tried to play some TV shows on this laptop and it started out fine then it froze up and crashed. Next I tried to play Paladins on this laptop and as seen in the picture it was a horrible experience. The eyes on the champions were ghostly like and the background was blue and it's not supposed to look like that. Also I would like to add that the laptop is not light weight it's actually a bit heavier than I expected. The last picture is what the game is supposed to look like. The last picture is taken from my desktop, check out the difference in how the game is supposed to look as in to what it looks like on the laptop. . I purchase the laptop again this time of 15.6 and I'm getting the same issues I had with the 17.3 don't waste your money on this laptop.

reviews.name: Chris Dietz
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2019
reviews.title: Terrific gaming laptop with horrible battery life
reviews.review_text: I purchased the model with the Ryzen 7 3750H CPU and GTX 1660Ti graphics card. The laptop overall is very fast. The NVME OS drive was able to transfer at over 950 MB/s. Not as great as a Samsung NVME, but still better than a SATA SSD. The secondary D: drive was 1tb, and it's performance was abysmal. It would only write to the drive at 40 MB/s. The dual fans werent overwhelmingly loud when gaming, however they are still running at over 2500 rpm even when the system is idling. Farcry 5 was able to run at over 60 fps on max settings. The reason why I ended up returning this laptop is because of the terrible battery life. I understand that if I'm gaming or using a moderate amount of CPU that the battery life would be terrible. I turned all settings to maximum battery life, both in the asus software, and in the control panel's power settings. I dimmed the display to minimum, and set the refresh rate to 48hz. I used device manager and disabled the GTX1660. The keyboard LEDs were turned off. Wifi was on and connected by itself to a mobile hotspot. The laptop was idling with no apps open and just sitting at the desktop. It was using the minimum amount of power that I could set it at. The battery lasted 1 hour, 15 minutes from 100 percent to 5 percent. Using a kill-a-watt, this laptop was using 50 watts while idling. This is why the laptop's battery was unable to keep up. While playing Farcry 5, the kill-a-watt showed the laptop was using 130 watts.  This is basically a desktop computer with a built in UPS. I would have loved to keep the laptop, but needed to have a low power mode last at least 2-3 hours.

reviews.name: CYRUS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019
reviews.title: 1660ti Beast
reviews.review_text: I bought the metallic 1660ti version and ive had it for a week so far, here is my thoughts: Pro's: 1. Noise: It stays pretty cool and quiet even in its loudest mode called turbo. Balanced is completely silent and still decently fast. 2. Display: Although small the display is pretty sharp and a nice 120hz. I do wish it had GSync but overall you cant get everything for this great of a price. 3. Speed: This thing is quite the monster, its fast with the 1660ti. Im quite impressed by it. Cons: 1. Silent mode: There is a mode called silent mode, In my opinion I think that mode is unusable. Its too slow for me. I bet it is good when you are trying to save battery life. 2. Now that leads into the next con, battery life. It seems it only lasts around 1 and a half hours even in balanced mode. Maybe im wrong about that but it seems very short. Edit: This has been fixed since this review. ASUS was very quick to bugfix it and I am impressed. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3. Sleep mode: Sometimes when I close the laptop and try to open it back up the display doesnt start up again. I can still hear the error sound when I type but there is no display, seems like a small bug. I have to usually hard reboot to start it again. I contacted support and they seemed very responsive though. Hope it gets fixed.

reviews.name: Francesca Cook
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
reviews.title: Incredible, but minor issues when delivered.
reviews.review_text: This is absolutely the best laptop I've ever bought. I've played many games on it and even did a few benchmarks. On the benchmark, I scored 43% in gaming, 69% in desktop (EDIT: I got the benchmark to hit 80% in desktop!) (NEWEST EDIT: I got it to hit 82% in desktop!!), and 45% in workstation using UserBenchmark program on EZOC (turbo). In room temperatures, it stays relatively cool. I played Overwatch recently, and the GPU tempurature orbitid 70°C. This is no means the best and most powerful laptop, but all the games I played were well above 60fps. Pros: 1. build quality is superb 2. Stays cool in room tempuratures 3. Display is incredibly clear and fast 4. SSD boot took 13 seconds 5. Multi tasking handles really well Cons: 1. When it first arrived, I had to reinstall Windows because the laptop kept freezing. 2. It's not a big deal, but I would of liked to have an Nvidia sticker on the laptop. It just doesn't feel right without it. All around, great laptop! Go with AMD all the way, you cannot beet the performance for the price!

reviews.name: Angel Martinez
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
reviews.title: Amazing for it's price
reviews.review_text: I gotten the Gtx 1650|256 SSD|Ryzen 5 3550H Version I gotta say It's a very good price to performances considering it's a laptop that's not breaking the bank too much. The GTX 1650 is a Good budget card to play all the latest games in Medium-High settings in 1080p. I'm quite surprised that they kept the price this low considering you get a 1080p 120Hz Screen,Rbg keyboard,GTX1650, and a Ryzen Processor. A couple of things I dislike is the storage it's only 256gb that's not gonna cut, most likely you're gonna have to buy an HDD or another SSD and also the mousepad isn't that great but it works and also the speakers aren't that amazing so don't expect great audio lastly the battery life isn't that great don't expect to gaming for more than 2-3 hours.

reviews.name: RhiannonJ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
reviews.title: Awesome laptop! Highly recommend it!
reviews.review_text: I did a lot of research before purchasing the FX505DU. I had a limited budget and wanted the most bang for my bucks. I prepared for the transition from my 6.5 year old Samsung and had everything backed up on a USB flash drive. I made lots of notes of things to do in order when I received it. Mind you, I'm a 66 year old lady and not in the best of health but I've always been good with setting things up. Well, it arrived on July 8th after ordering it on July 5th. Gotta love Amazon Prime. I've had it now for nearly two days and everything has gone very smoothly. Loved it when a windows update came through and updated my bios to 305! PROS: -The keyboard is great and I love the 1 zone RGB. It's pretty easy to change the lighting settings in Armoury Crate after an auto update of ROG Live Service came through. -This laptop is fast and very responsive though it takes awhile getting it there so make sure you go through the Windows 10 settings with an fine toothed comb. -Noise levels are not noticable at all until you get to Turbo but even at that level it's not that loud. Love that you can easily change the fan modes on the keyboard by pressing FN + F5. -Thermals. Ok, I'm not a heavy duty gamer, but I do occasionally play a 15 year old game called Lineage II. No probems whatsoever and temps didn't get above 58c. Even while having 10 browser windows open in Firefox. -This FX505DU is solidly built. It's not that light weight with coming in at about 5 pounds but I personally like that. -NO bloatware! Just McCafee which I uninstalled. -The 120hz FHD IPS type panel is awesome and looks great. Just wish the gamma was a bit better but I was able to adjust that in Color Management in the Control Panel and set up my own profile. CONS: None that I have found so far. Overall, I highly recommend the FX505DU and I'm very pleased and happy with my purchase. Don't sit on the fence with this one. Just go for it! I'm so glad I did!

reviews.name: Birds
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
reviews.title: This has abysmal battery life, and I love it!
reviews.review_text: Battery life: On light loads like browsing news sites on Edge or grabbing games on Steam, you might see around two hours on a full charge, and if that's a deal-breaker for you, you'll want to re-evaluate your criteria for a laptop. The CPU and GPU in this laptop have been fantastic for my use case (Fusion 360, ZBrush, Blender, and all the games I care to throw at it), but the 48Wh battery in this means you'll likely only want this if you only plan to have this plugged in most of the time, because that two hours I mentioned earlier is going to look a lot more like one hour or less when you start driving the CPU/GPU hard. Worth mentioning, btw, the battery is fairly easy to swap if you ever find the need after the warranty runs out. No way of knowing what kind of availability we'll see for replacements after this is EoL'd, but if they're available whenever that day comes, it's just a matter of unplugging the battery, removing a couple retaining screws, and gently lifting it out. Unlike some devices, the battery in this laptop isn't held down with a giant mess of glue, so this has the potential to have a very long service life without being a pain to DIY repair. Gaming performance: You'll have to make sacrifices in most titles from the past few years to get this to hold 120FPS at 1080p, but those sacrifices are usually pretty minor (AA isn't that big a deal at this screen size), and if I can't hit 120, I have yet to find any game that didn't get some approximation of 60FPS with the settings maxed or some hard-to-notice sacrifices in quality. I am extremely satisfied with the oomph this thing brings. As a kinda average example, I was almost always seeing 120FPS in Destiny 2 before I just had to go in and screw things up by deviating from the auto settings. As for build quality, this thing is... well, kinda tough. Can't say I've been tossing it around like a frisbee to really test it, but the screen is decently reinforced and has only a reasonable amount of flex, the hinges are solid and stay exactly where you tell them to stay, and the plastic used in the lower housing feels like either ABS or PA6. I'm not about to put this under the knife to check for any fiber reinforcement, but I at least found it had a healthy amount of give to it when I opened it up to swap the HDD for an SSD. It'd probably handle an impact about as well as a laptop this size can. Noise: Odds are, unless you're doing light tasks or playing older games that the IGP can handle on its own, you're going to have fan noise. Some games, like World of Warcraft, are happy with a warm potato pushing pixels, so you can put the laptop in silent mode and actually enjoy silence. In situations where you have a high GPU load but nothing taxing the CPU, silent mode's a little less silent due to the GPU having its own fan, but I still found it bearable. Balanced is where you'll probably be most of the time, and while I can tell the machine's running on the other side of the room, it's not quite a jet engine. "Turbo" mode, at least until the hardware becomes questionably relevant, is more of a "hold my beer" mode, and is perfect for that jet turbine ambience, but a little dubious as a daily power mode. Thankfully, you can swap between all three of those using a function key. I've also noticed that the power mode does have some influence over download speed on fast connections, but downloading a few gigs on silent mode still wasn't a terrible experience. RGB: Lastly, if you have this laptop or are about to have it, you'll need to go into the device tab in Armoury Crate to change lighting settings on the keyboard. Just mentioning it here because I spent a dog's age trying to figure out why the Aura tab was only making my keyboard flash for a second before going back to rainbow puke mode. Btw, if rainbow puke's more your speed, it's the default, and it's quite vibrant, so you'll be happy with that right out of the box. It does flicker a little between some color transitions, but it wasn't any worse than most of the other devices I've seen with a color-cycle mode.

reviews.name: DesuIsSparta
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
reviews.title: This laptop is a beast, but has some serious issues
reviews.review_text: (8/1/19)** I can't handle this laptop anymore. It's running like trash the more I use it. Temperatures are OK (not too hot, not as cool as they should be). Everything keeps turning black. Likely a GPU failure or a bad cpu/gpu combo (amd / nvidia aren't common). I'm past my return window so now I'll just have to find someone to sell it to. Very disappointed in this company. They won't even respond to our reviews. (7/21/19) ** I bought this laptop primarily for programming and heavy projects which require a lot of RAM, processing power, and even graphics processing power. For the price and the specs, it looked incredible. The day I got it, I started encountering some issues but I figured that I juts needed to install some updates and what-not. But now a month in since my initial purchase, I am still encountering some of the same issues. I'll skip over the tiny ones because I'm sure they'll be fixed in an upcoming update. The biggest issue I have with this laptop is that for some reason, it can not handle browser media well. What I mean by this, is if you are using a web browser like Chrome and try to play a YouTube video or a video which is otherwise embedded (whether it be HTML5 or Flash), it may have issues. In my experience, the whole screen turns black, and sometimes it fixes itself.. but often times, it does not. The issue is so bad sometimes, in fact, that the computer becomes completely unresponsive and you have to force power it down by holding the power button. Other times, it's just annoying that it renders black or green boxes all over the place. Almost looks like a sign of a failing graphics card, but every graphics test I've done has worked out well. This issue absolutely makes the laptop unusable. Another issue is that the touchpad is really strange. If your hands aren't completely 100% dry, the touchpad will not respond well at all. I've tried adjusting the sensitivity options, but they don't really help. The cursor will skip all around. I would think that most people purchasing this laptop will be using a mouse, but I prefer to not carry an extra peripheral with me to meetings. Minor thing, not really an issue.. There is no way to change the color of the backlit keyboard as of the time I'm writing this review. It's either on or off. It seems absurd to me that the keyboard is RGB but you can't set it to be a single color. It looks ridiculous when I want to have a white or blue backlighting but all I can get is the full rainbow spectrum. I tried installing Aura but it froze the computer every single time on startup and I had to restore the operating system to a previous point just to get it to work again. Also the function keys randomly decide when they want to work. I found that after the computer starts up or wakes up, it takes about 2 or 3 full minutes before the function keys begin to work. Sometimes even longer after sleep mode, to around 4 or 5 minutes. Negative stuff aside, I really do love this laptop and I just wish it would work  like it's supposed to. It's light, slick, has room for expandable memory, and will hold up well with its processing and graphics power.. if they can become a bit more compatible with each other. It doesn't look crazy like those other 'gaming' laptops where they're full of accented colors and flashing lights everywhere. If the issues I mentioned could be fixed, I would easily give this laptop 5 stars. But until then, it's really borderline 3 for me. Do you know what it's like to try and show your boss a video and have your laptop freeze up or stop working? It's embarassing. My $50 cracked-plastic junk laptop can handle it just fine.. why can't this $1k+ one?

reviews.name: Nick
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
reviews.title: Seemed nice at first, then I started having issues...
reviews.review_text: EDIT: Originally I left a stellar review for this thing, however, right after having it for about a week it started freaking out and I couldn’t justify keeping it for its $1,100 price tag, so I filed a return with Amazon and shipped it out yesterday. It was black screening randomly, games started running horribly, it was very odd and inconsistent. One day I’d play BF5 maxed out just fine, the next I’d struggle to play it on low. I personally think the culprit was the CPU, the mobile Ryzen series is about as powerful as a 7th or 8th gen mobile i5 which isn’t a power CPU at all. As for the thing black screening and crashing, no idea, wasn’t willing to keep it to find out when I paid what I did for it. For $1,100, you should really not buy this thing if you want a laptop that will just work.

reviews.name: Cary Preston
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2019
reviews.title: Outstanding system for the price
reviews.review_text: Met my needs for a new gaming laptop perfectly. Pros: • Solid, sturdy build • Powerful- game performance exceeded my expectations, even with just 8 gig of RAM • Keyboard is surprisingly comfortable to type with • The laptop's monitor is high quality, and the high refresh rate makes watching live sports or gaming look great Cons • Fans do a great job keeping the system cool, but they can be loud • The trackpad is poor, especially for someone that's used to Macs. Since this is billed as a gaming PC this is a minor issue- stick to using a mouse and you'll never notice For the price I couldn't be happier with this laptop. If you're looking for an affordable gaming system you can't go wrong with this.

reviews.name: Matt Sayar
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
reviews.title: I hate this laptop
reviews.review_text: I hate it. I hate it I hate it I hate it, I hate it. I have a computer science degree, but I can't figure out how to make the keyboard lights stop doing that flashing rainbow effect that it does by default. Everything I've researched has pointed to downloading some Aura software and then I can fiddle with the light settings, so that's what I did. Except the software won't even start for me, and the internet consensus is just "yeah, the software sucks, nobody knows how to fix it." I've spent two evenings trying to get these lights to just have one, static, unchanging color, and I'm stumped. I'd rather spend time with my family but I've been busy updating BIOSes and uninstalling/reinstalling software and scouring forums for answers, and I have nothing to show for it. And the mousepad, oh lawd the mousepad. I'm watching the mouse cursor dance all over my screen as I type this review because the base of my thumb keeps rubbing the mousepad. There's no quick way to turn the mousepad off, so... I just gotta deal with it. Hopefully I don't accidentally click something while I'm typing this! And my bigger gripe with the mousepad is how the bottom half feels so... cheap. Like it's about to pop out. The top half is solid and nice, but as soon as you get to the bottom you gotta deal with it having some play. It's segregated into two halves like there's a left-button and a right-button, but the "buttons" are touch-sensitive anyway, making it redundant and useless. If you actually DO want to "click" the buttons, good luck; your mouse pointer will move as you press into the mousepad, making you miss whatever you were hovering over. You probably think those two gripes are stupid and miss the point of a gaming laptop entirely. "But does this laptop run games well??" Yeah, I played some Far Cry and it ran great. But I want to do other things with this computer, and like it or not, literally everything else involves interacting with the distractingly-colorful keyboard and the fidgety mousepad. This machine isn't cheap, and after paying a cool grand for it, I'd expect more attention to detail. "But why don't you just contact support?" Haha! How? "Asus support" is an oxymoron. Just like I'm a moron for waiting too long to return this laptop. I hate it. I wish I could get a refund, but I thought I could figure out this keyboard light issue and get used to the mousepad, but I can't. And now I'm stuck with it.

reviews.name: Rosa
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
reviews.title: My thoughts about this laptop
reviews.review_text: I would like to say, that this laptop for the price, it's one of the best, mostly because in my country (Panama) this laptop would cost around like 2k dollars. I'm going to compare this laptop with my old one (Acer Nitro 5 2017) Aside of better graphics and newer Intel, it's pretty lightweight compare to the Nitro 5. A little to the downside is that it doesn't come with a lot of ports on the side (3 USB ports) (1 audio jack) (1 HDMI and Wlan port). All on the left side, right side does not have anything. The Nitro 5 has a C-USB port and a SD Card port. It doesn't heat that much, I played Apex and League of Legends and it's pretty smooth. The gpu is Nvidia 1660 Ti. Apex settings in all high. Continuing my comparison with the Nitro 5, the Asus doesn't have a keyboard shortcut to pause, play next, play before, pause key for the music, a little bit awkward if you're playing and listening music and you want to go to the next song. Aside from that, it's a pretty good laptop, it has a great design. I would recommend this laptop.

reviews.name: Edward
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
reviews.title: Overall, Great Budget Gaming Laptop
reviews.review_text: GTX 1650; Ryzen 5, Vega 8; 8GB RAM First off, I actually expected the entire laptop, including the top cover, to be aluminum or some sort of metal, but it is entirely plastic. Did not bother me too much since the laptop is relatively cheap, but it does subtract from the build quality a little bit. However, I would say the keyboard is extremely satisfying to type on and I sometimes even use it instead of my mechanical keyboard. It plays competitive multiplayer games well (Overwatch, Apex Legends, Fortnite, etc.), but I have yet to try the new Modern Warfare which I have just bought and other more graphically demanding games. The thing that bothers me the most about this laptop is that on certain surfaces, it slides, but that might just be my desk since it seems to work fine on others.

reviews.name: Woeful Zeus
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
reviews.title: Great laptop for the price.
reviews.review_text: Great all around laptop, good for casual gaming and great for work. My only dislike is the FX505DT doesn't have a USB C port so adding a docking station becomes a challenge. Also doesn't have a Display Port but does have a single HDMI port that will support up to 120hz monitor. I bought a 144hz monitor to go with this and can only send a 120hz signal to it. Not great if you intend to use this as both a desktop AND laptop but as a stand alone laptop it is outstanding, especially at the $700 price point.

reviews.name: Rocky T.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.title: Don't buy if you aren't computer literate...well, don't buy anyway
reviews.review_text: 1st - I paid for a 120hz monitor that runs in 60hz by the default onboard video. Can you go into bios and swap to the 1660Ti? Nope. In order to use the 1660Ti video card, you have to go into each app/game manually and make the 1660Ti the default video. (If you didn't know any better, you would be paying for more than you're using.) Once you figure out to make the 1660Ti the default video card for the app/game, do you get that app/game in 120hz? NOPE! The onboard video manages the display at 60hz. So your game may be telling you you're getting 200FPS, but you're display isn't putting it out. So either way, you wasted money. 2nd- The laptop comes with a flashing backlit keyboard, but no buttons or software to change to a solid color. So I have to sit here and stare at it. Personal problem to me because I want a solid color. Close the lid and open the lid, then who knows what you get. It may be a solid color you don't want, but usually it is flashing. No rhyme or reason to fixing the keyboard lighting. 3rd- The mouse pad feels very cheap. Like it is loosely fitted. I had to get a usb mouse to use because I found it to be so aggravating. There are a few more issues I have had to fix, but the bottom line is I expected much more from the supposed leader in gaming hardware. My next job is to scour the internet looking for fixes to clean up what Asus should have done before this thing left the factory. Very disappointed. (This is not my first Asus laptop but could be my last.) Bottom line, don't buy this unless you know how to fix it to get what you paid for. And without a proper bios fix, you will not get the 120hz monitor you're paying for. So best thing is to just move on to another product. *update* Gave up on this laptop. Just writing it off as a complete waste of money. Going to give it to the grand kids to play with. Bought a different laptop for $200 cheaper and it's smokes this one. I'll never buy an Asus laptop again.

reviews.name: Brandon Dubbert
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019
reviews.title: This laptop is AWESOME.
reviews.review_text: I did a ton of research on this laptop before buying. I previously had an Acer Nitro 5 that was a decent gaming laptop, but this blows it out of the water in both build and performance. Here are my pros and cons: Pros: -120hz screen is beautiful. Makes everything look great. -Build quality. Top of the laptop is metal and the rest is a super sturdy brushed plastic. -Overall performance is amazing. -Keyboard feels great and the extra width on the spacebar is a nice touch. -Surround sound DTS app in the Armoury  Crate software using a headset/earbuds sounds fantastic. Cons: -Battery life can be low. I usually stay plugged in or on balance mode/power saver if not. -Armoury Crate software took a few minutes to get acclimated with to adjust the lighting effects and color for the RGB keyboard. -The finish on the plastic in the inside shows fingerprints rather easily. Not a huge deal. Overall, an amazing laptop at a great price. This is my third try at an ASUS product after having a bad experience with a desktop GPU and an OLD model ASUS ROG laptop....and needless to say, the third try was the charm!

reviews.name: Adam
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
reviews.title: Excellent entry level Ryzen laptop
reviews.review_text: Overall this is an excellent entry level gaming laptop. It has played all the games I want at Med - High settings at 1080 P with no issue. The screen is bright and the keyboard is the best I've ever typed on. The Ryzen 3550H is a powerhouse and pairs nicely with the GTX1650. Also, the 120 Hz panel is a dream and actually gets used as I see 120 FPS in Fallout 4 on High - Max settings at 1080 P. My only issue is the track pad. I'm not sure if it is the surface or drivers, but it lags and is sometimes totally unresponsive.

reviews.name: dylan hale
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019
reviews.title: (Edit, fixed by Asus) Maybe a fluke but mine's Throttled to heck and back.
